loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
Zablon has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last three years. He is 48 years old, married to Esther, and they are blessed with four school-aged children. 

Zablon got to know about KADET LTD through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru. This will be his fourth loan. Zablon repaid his previous loans of KES 70,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizers, to pay for farm labor and to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat for his retail shop. In the future, Zablon hopes to own a supermarket in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, to pay for farm labor and to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking fat for his retail shop

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah sells children's wear, bread and cooking utensils at Elmina.  Sarah has received senior high school education.  She is married and has 4 children.  Her husband is a teacher. 

Sarah has been selling children's wear, bread and cooking utensils for 10 years.  She assists her spouse in the payment of household expenses and school fees.  Her loan will be used to buy more cooking utensils to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 49, who was born in Urubamba and currently resides there, is the married mother of four children, three of whom live independently. A farmer for 30 years, she cultivates a wide variety of vegetables such as corn, onions, lettuce, cauliflower, and potatoes. The crops that she chooses to grow are based upon the different seasons. When she is not able to grow vegetables on her farm, Victoria goes to the market to buy vegetables that she then sells to her clients.

Victoria is requesting a $600 loan in order to buy vegetables to bring to her clients so that she does not lose their business. She is committed to making all necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell to her clients when her farm is not producing enough.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Carmelita has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Carmelita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts & blouses to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley  vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su esposo y su hijo de 12 años de edad; ella se dedica a la actividad comercial, que  ejerce desde su miscelánea ubicada  en su propia casa, donde vende productos energéticos,alopaticos y mercancías variadas tales como prendas de vestir, accesorios, papelería y prodtos de drogueria etc. Su negocio inició cuando decidió generar ingresos para su hogar de alguna manera y fue apoyada por su esposo para lograrlo, así fue como  inicialmente y de manera independiente,  empezó vendiendo productos energéticos de varios laboratorios a sus vecinos y amigos, con el tiempo también agregó prendas de vestir,  productos de belleza y poco a poco toda mecánica por la que  sus clientes preguntaban y ella no tenía. 
Su sueño es adicionar a los productos energéticos, mayor volumen de drogas alopáticas de consumo libre, porque quiere integrar a su miscelánea la línea de farmacia con mayor fuerza. Su desafió es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para comprar en mayor volumen y obtener  buenos descuentos por su compra de contado. En la actualidad vende de contado en el punto comercial,  pero tiene una cartera de clientes rentables que cada día le recomiendan nuevos compradores y es necesario complacerlos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar  especialmente ropa que tiene encargada. Mientras Shirley trabaja sigue fortaleciendo su negocio con sus esfuerzos y generando una rentabilidad no menor del 21%, una rotación de inventarios de 10 días y una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 15.
texts.en:
Shirley lives in the city of Barranquilla with her ​​husband and 12 year old son.  She has a business which she runs from her general store located in her home, where she sells energy products and miscellaneous goods such as clothing, accessories, stationery, etc.  

Her business began when she decided to somehow generate income for her household, and her husband supported her in it.  It was in this way that she initially and independently began selling energy products from several laboratories to neighbors and friends.  She eventually also added clothing, beauty products, and gradually all the other items that customers had requested that she didn't stock.

Her dream is to add a number of freely available allopathic drugs to her energy products, because she wants to integrate a pharmacy line into her general store.  Her challenge is having enough working capital to buy in greater volume and to get good discounts for cash purchases. 

Today she sells items from her business locale for cash, but she has a roster of profitable customers who recommend new buyers to her on a daily basis, and it is necessary for her to keep them happy.  This is the reason that she is coming for a Kiva loan.  It is her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, specifically to buy clothing that has been ordered. 

While Shirley is working, she continues to strengthen her business through her efforts.  She generates a return of no less than 21%, an inventory turnover of 10 days and a turnover of accounts receivable of 15 days.

loans.use: specifically to buy clothes.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy has been in mixed farming in Kitale, Western Kenya, for the last 5 years. He produces milk and maize, which he sells at the local market. He is married with 4 children, 3 of whom are already in school.

Timothy has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more birds for his poultry business. He hopes the business will make his life much better and enable him to venture into the motorcycle-transport business.

Timothy notes that diseases and low feeds during the dry season are the impediments to farmers in the area.

loans.use: to purchase birds for his poultry business

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She is engaged in farming. Rosie plants rice and corn crops on her land. She is able to buy her family's basic needs through her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes to continue supporting her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Veronica Awino

texts.en: Veronica is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 2 and 6. She describes herself to be industrious, intelligent, and honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells onions, tomatoes, fruits, and cereals. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. Her primary customers are local households and travelers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate space for business operations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase vegetables and maize for sale. Her business goal is to become involved in the sale of ready-made clothing within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and maize for sale

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: Leonel tiene su negocio que es ebanistería y carpintería, él tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de negocio son 8 años que Leonel tiene en este negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre se encuentran satisfechos con este tipo de negocios, inicio trabajando como ayudante en un taller y cuando aprendió el oficio emigrando a Costa Rica fue aquí que aprendió este tipo de negocio y decidió establecer el propio. El crédito es para la compra madera, cepillos, pega, serruchos, entre otros
texts.en:
Leonel has a woodwork and carpentry business. He has a lot of experience in this work because he has been doing it for 8 years. Most of his clients are always pleased with his handicraft. 

He first started working as an assistant in a carpenter’s shop and after learning the trade he migrated to Costa Rica and this is where he learned this type of business and decided to start his own. 

This loan is to buy wood, brushes, glue, saws and other things.

loans.use: to buy wood, brushes, glue, saws and other supplies

loans.name: Noonkokua

texts.en:
Noonkokua, 36 years old, is a married  lady. She has three children who depend on her. She has been a farmer in Mau-Narok, Kenya, for six years with an income of about KES 6,000 per month.

She learned about KADET Ltd. through other women registered in her area of residence. She repaid a previous loan successfully and without complication. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd., and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yeimy Julissa

texts.es: Yeimy Julissa, de veinticinco años de edad, reside al Occidente del país en un cantón rural del país, es madre soltera y dependen económicamente de ella sus dos menores hijas Esperanza y Tatiana, una de ellas estudia y la otra en ocasiones la debe de llevar al lugar donde tiene su carrito donde vende tostadas de plátano, papa, yuca o tortas de jamon o carne. Yeimy sólo cuenta con este negocio como fuente de ingreso no tiene ninguna otra ayuda, ella vende en los alrededores de la ciudad cercana a la que vive, ha sabido identificar un sitio en el cual le buscan sus clientes ya que sus tostadas y tortas son muy preferidas por niños y adultos, por el precio accesible, el buen servicio y lo higiénico de los mismos. Yeimy desea comprar mayor cantidad de plátano y papas para freír, hacer algunas reparaciones a su carretón y comprar otro tambo de gas y espera con la ayuda de INTEGRAL, igual que en otras ocasiones ha recurrido para lograrlo, a fin de que no les falte nada a sus pequeñas hijas que son su inspiración
texts.en:
Yeimy Julissa, age 25, lives in a rural canton in the western part of the country. She is a single mother with two young daughters, Esperanza and Tatiana, who are financially dependent on her. One of her daughters is in school and the other occasionally accompanies her while she is working. Yeimy has a cart where she sells fried plantains, potatoes, cassava, and ham or beef sandwiches. She works alone in this business as her source of income since she receives no other assistance.

Yeimy sells in the surrounding neighborhoods of the city near where she lives. She knows how to identify an area where customers are craving fried foods and sandwiches, which are very popular among children and adults. Yeimy provides good service and her food is affordable and prepared under sanitary conditions.

Yeimy wants to buy a large quantity of plantains and potatoes for frying. She also wants to make a few repairs to her cart and acquire another drum of gas. Just like on other occasions, Yeimy hopes the support from Apoyo Integral will help her to accomplish all of these things. Her young daughters serve as her inspiration, so Yeimy does everything she can so that they lack nothing.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of plantains and potatoes, pay for repairs to her food cart, and acquire a drum of gas.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Marco Tulio tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la aldea de La Pimienta. Lleva 10 años de casado con su esposa Mirna y tienen una hija de 8 años de edad. La señora Mirna es ama de casa y el señor Marco tiene un taller de venta de llantas y reparación. 

El taller está ubicado en el patio de su casa. Allí el señor Marco vende llantas nuevas y usadas. También ofrece servicios de cambio de llantas, pintura de carros y reparación de los golpes en los carros accidentados. El taller está abierta 9 horas al día, de lunes a sábado. 

El señor Marco pasó 8 años fuera del país. Durante este tiempo ahorró para poder regresar a Honduras y estar cerca a su familia con el fin de poner su propio negocio. Este es el primer crédito que ha solicitado el señor Marco y lo va a utilizar en la compra de llantas para surtir el taller. Su esperanza es que en un futuro próximo, logrará ser dueño propio de su casa.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is 38 years old, and he lives in the village of La Pimienta.  He has been married to his wife, Mirna, for ten years; and they have an eight year old daughter.  Mirna is a housewife, and Marco has a tire sales and repair shop.

The shop is located on the patio of his house.  That is where Marco sells new and used tires.  He also offers services to change tires, paint cars, and repair damage from accidents.  His shop is open nine hours a day from Monday through Saturday.

Marco spent eight years outside of the country.  During this time he saved in order to be able to return to Honduras to be close to his family and establish his own business.

This is the first loan that Marco has requested.  He will use it to buy tires to stock his shop.  His hope for the near future is to manage to be the owner of his own house.

loans.use: to buy new and used tires.

loans.name: Najiah

texts.en:
Najiah is a 56 year old married woman with five sons.  She works in agriculture and earns a low income.  Najiah also raises laying hens and sells their products. 

Najiah wants to increase her income and would like to purchase more laying hens, cages and food.  But the amount of money she has isn't enough to cover the cost.  She needs a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. 

Increased sales and profits will enable Najiah to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more laying hens, cages and food.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Elenita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Elenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
Carmen de 30 años, hace 2 años atrás que empezó con esta actividad, le gusta su tienda por la tranquilidad al trabajar desde su casa.

Trabaja solo, todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Su dificultad es el mal clima, cuando empiezan las lluvias su sector se inunda de agua y le dificulta las ventas de sus productos. Está separada de su esposo, pero vive con sus 6 hijos de 12, 10, 8, 6, 3, y 1 año.

Quiere comprar con el prestamo arroz, enlatdos, aceites etc. Su objetivo es salir adelante con sus hijos y poder cumplir su meta de construir la casa mas grande para vivir mas cómodos con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen, 30, started this activity two years ago; she likes her store because working from home is peaceful.  She works alone every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night.  Her difficulty is bad weather because when the rains come her neighborhood floods and sales are difficult.  

She’s separated from her husband but she lives with her six children who are 12, 10, 8, 6, 3 and 1 year old.  She wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned goods, oil, etc.  Her objective is to get ahead with her children and to reach her goal of building a larger house to live more comfortably with her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, tuna and oil.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high competition from other food stall operators. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase food items, bundle of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items, bundle of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
For almost 12 years of being exposed to the farming business, Julio was able to learn some farming techniques on how to improve his farmland. He is proud that he had been engaged in this kind of business because he is able to earn a living. According to him, farming is primarily the main source of income for his family.

Julio is 58 years old and married. The couple has been blessed with three children. One of them is married already,one is studying and one is working. Julio has been planting rice on his half hectare. Aside from the farming business, he is also engaged in buying and selling carabao within their village. He works hard to sustain the needs of his family, especially for his high school student on whom he is spending his profit. Julio would like to increase his yields this crop season but his income is not enough to buy farm supplies needed in his farming business. With this regard, he is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000. He hopes that through his loan, he can sustain his family needs and let his youngest child finish his degree course.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 31 años, convive con Milka de 28 años, fruto de esta relación nacieron Max y Yegner  con los que viven en su casa propia ubicado en el centro poblado de Chuvivana del distrito de Sivia. Jesús, es un agricultor que se ha dedicado por mas de 10 años al cultivo de café. Su campo agrícola se encuentra dentro de su distrito a 30 minutos de su casa. Pues es ahí donde trabaja com mucha dedicación y entrega en compañia de su esposa. Sin embargo, nos comenta que fracasó como comerciante ambulante a causa de un accidente de transito donde perdio su mercadería, desde entonces se vio en la necesidad de emprender otro negocio que no le exigiera mucha inversión. Así que lo único que tenía era su terreno, desde entonces trabaja arduamene desde que amanece hasta que termina el día, y poco a poco fue que tuvo estabilidad económica. Jesús esta contento con su producción, en un futuro desea salir a la ciudad a emprender un nuevo negocio. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles invertirá en la ampliación de sus cultivos de café, por lo que comprará semillas y abono.
texts.en:
Jesús, 31, lives with Milka, 28, and they have two children: Max and Yegner that they live with in their own house located in the settlement of Chuvivana in Sivia District.  Jesús is a farmer and has been growing coffee for over ten years.  His farmland is located in a district 30 minutes from home.  He works there with much dedication and devotion in company of his wife.  

However, he comments that he failed as a street vendor due to a traffic accident where he lost all his merchandise.  Since then, he found himself in need of finding a different business that didn’t require much investment.  The only thing he had was his piece of land so he works hard from dawn to dusk and gradually has attained economic stability.  Jesús is happy with his production and in the future would like to go to the city to start a new business.

This is his first MFP loan and he commits to make his installment payments punctually.  He will use the 1500 new soles to invest in the expansion of his coffee crops.  He will therefore buy seeds and manure.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds and manure.

loans.name: Rose Michelle

texts.fr: Rose Michelle est âgée de 45 ans. C’est une femme dynamique et très expérimentée dans le commerce en détail. Elle a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés régulièrement. Depuis tantôt dix ans, elle a créé sa propre petite entreprise de revente de chaussures en gros et de bâches en plastique. Elle a déjà obtenu plusieurs crédits qu'elle a bien utilisés pour développer son activité. Elle a toujours remboursé ses prêts sans difficultés. Elle s'approvisionne en république dominicaine et à Panama. Son activité marche très bien dans la zone où elle se trouve. Pour bien profiter de cette opportunité, Rose Michelle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock de chaussures neufs.

loans.use: acheter un nouveau stock de chaussures neufs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND FARMING

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en:
Maximo has been living in Baba his entire life. He has a primary education, and is a very hard worker. Through his farming he has been able to raise six children. He lives with his wife Marcia, a son and a daughter. They help him plant rice, plantains, bananas, and corn. He also raises some chickens, pigs, and cows. He hopes he can invest in a chicken coop so he can establish a business. He is optimistic about the loan because chicken sales provide a good secondary source of income in case of emergencies. With the extra profits he hopes to help pay for one of his grandchildren's university studies.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Invest in a chicken coop

loans.name: Jemiyyet

texts.en: A. Jemiyyet is 39 and married with a big family of 4 children. He has one calf and to make his small business successful, he has applied for a 1200 USD loan to purchase a cow and an additional calf.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf.

loans.name: Alicibiades

texts.es:
Mr. Alcibiades Ramírez is 47 years old, and married with Mrs. Carmen Riveros (43). They have 3 children of 16, 15, and 6 years old respectively. The first two go to secondary school, the youngest is in primary school.

Alcibiades has owned a grocery store at his home for 7 years. He sells all kinds of basic goods like sugar, pasta, milk, eggs, vegetables, etc. Before that, he worked as a driver for a company that distributes bottled water. He decided to open the business because in the neighborhood where he lives, there are not many grocery stores and there is a not much competition.

He told us that the loan he is requesting is to buy wholesale merchandise like rice, sugar, flour, and herbs, which will allow his to lower the cost base of his merchandise and offer more variety to his customers.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

El señor Alcibiades Ramírez tiene 47 años y está casado con la señora Carmen Riveros de 43 años; tienen 3 hijos de 16,15 y 6 años respectivamente, los dos primeros están cursando la secundaria y el menor está realizando los estudios primarios.

Alcibiades posee una despensa en su domicilio desde hace 7 años, donde vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, fideos, leche, huevos, verduras, etc.; anteriormente trabajaba como chofer para una Empresa dedicada a la distribución de Agua Mineral. Decidió abrir el negocio debido a que en la zona donde vive no cuentan con muchos comercios dedicados a ese ramo, por lo que no tiene mucha competencia.

Nos comenta que el préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mercaderías en mayor volumen como ser arroz, azúcar, harina y yerba lo cual le permitirá abaratar el costo de sus mercaderías y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise like rice, sugar, flour, and herbs

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana is 60 years old, a hard-working, selfless mother to five children, despite her advanced age she still has sufficient vitality and strength to continue fufilling her work as an artisan, for which she is well-known and respected within her community for the excellent and fine work she creates. Susana begins her work in the early morning hours so that later she can offer her creations by walking in the busiest places in her town, while her husband tries to earn a living through physical labor with his only tool, his tricycle, offering his services to the community. Through this couple's daily performance they can enjoy their well-being and education of their children.

Today the demand for Susana's knittings has dramatically increased and in order to take advantage of this growth she seeks a loan of $200, which will enable the growth of their capital and aquire a range of wool to later knit in the unique and incomparable way that Susana knows how to knit, with the goal to sell the items and generate better income for the family. MFP offers support to continue knitting and cherishing the family's wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Susana tiene 60 años, madre trabajadora y abnegada D. 5 hijos, pese a la edad avanzada que tiene aún sigue contando con suficiente vitalidad y fuerza para seguir desempeñando el trabajo D. siempre, la artesanía, oficio por la que se hizo muy conocida y respetada dentro D. su entorno, por los excelentes y finos trabajos que realiza. Susana inicia con su labor desD. tempranas horas D. la madrugada, para luego ofrecerlos en forma ambulatoria en los lugares más concurridos D. su localidad, mientras su esposo trata D. ganarse la vida a base D. mucho esfuerzo físico con su única herramienta D. trabajo, su triciclo, ofreciendo sus servicios a la población. A través del desempeño diario D. esta pareja D. esposos pueden gozar D. bienestar y educación sus hijos.Actualmente la demanda D. sus tejidos se ha incrementada D. una forma descomunal y para aprovechar este fenómeno solicita un préstamo D. 200 dólares, este dinero le permitirá aumentar su capital y adquirir una infinita gama D. lanas para luego tejerlas D. la única e incomparable forma que ella sabe hacerlo, con el fin D. comercializarlas y generar mejores ingresos económicos para su familia. Brindémosle nuestro apoyo para siga tejiendo y albergando los anhelos D. su numerosa familia

loans.use: Wool for knitting

loans.name: Herbakkuk Group

texts.en:
The Herbakkuk Trust Group is a group of 13 members from the small community of Atwedie, near Nkawkaw. It is the type of town where everyone says hello to each other using their names. Needless to say, the members of this group have known each other for many years. They came together based on their shared desire and enthusiasm to expand their businesses. Members of this group are involved in a variety of businesses including grocery shops, meat stores, pharmacies, and sandal making. Another member of the group, Stephen B., owns the first of two pharmacies in town. He opened the pharmacy in 1964. The community depends mostly on his store for their medicine. Therefore, he would like to expand his inventory with new medicine including medicine for malaria. Aside from providing the community with medicine, Stephen also takes care of his 16 children! 2 of them are in middle school and he hopes that they will continue their education to university level.

(*Photo Note: Asiedu is in the bottom row in white and Stephen is in the back row in green.)

loans.use: To purchase tin fish, tomatoes, milk, sugar, leather, glue, fresh meats, medicine, and various other inventory

loans.name: Linci

texts.es:
Linci is a seamstress with three years of experience who learnt how to sew from her mother. She is single and has no children.

She had several offers to travel to Spain and work as a maid, but following the advice of her parents she decided to stay and open her own tailoring business.

She will use the loan to buy an “Overlock” sewing machine which will help her to work faster and improve her work.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Linci es una costurera que se dedica al oficio hace más de 3 años, ella es soltera y sin hijos; el arte de la confección de las ropas lo adquirió de su madre.

Comenta Linci, que tuvo muchas ofertas para viajar a España a trabajar de empleada doméstica, pero siguió los consejos de sus padres prefirió quedar en el país he invertir en su propio negocio y abrir su propio taller de costura.

El préstamo que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de una máquina de coser tipo overlock que la ayudará a agilizar y mejorar su trabajo.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Swaumu's Mtanzania Group

texts.en:
Swaumu, age 32, is married and has three children (ages 5, 8, and 13). She owns a fishing business which she started in 2007. Swaumu sells fish from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$65.

She hopes to receive a loan to buy more fish for sale. She will share the loan with Mwantumu and Zaituni, her sub-group members who have businesses in fish and material sales.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for sale

loans.name: Gulmahmad

texts.ru:
Gulmahmad Bobonazarovich U. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a High School education. He is in the business of growing plants, in particular vegetables. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. He plans to use the loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. This business is the main source of income for the family and helps providing the local population with fresh vegetables. Gulmahmad plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Юлдошев Гулмахмад Бобоназарович житель города Яван.Возраст 39 лет , женат имеет 4 детей.Образование среднее.Занимается растениеводством. Сажает овощи. Опыт работы 10 лет.Кредит планирует использовать на покупку семян картофеля и удобрений.Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Так же развитие сельхоз сектора позволяет обеспечить население свежими овощами.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев .

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ana's Group

texts.es:
The Communal Bank “Hatun Ayllu D. Aqchapa” is a young organisation. Currently, it has 2 courses and 16 members. the members of this bank live in the Aqchapa community which is in the Quinua district. They mainly do agricultural and farming activites.

The members do different agricultural activites, such as selling vegetables, raising animals, selling cereals, sewing blankets and selling brick-a-brack.

The members need different amounts of money; 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, making a total of 8,850 soles that the Communal Bank needs as a loan.

The loans will be invested in buying guinea pigs for raising, buying cows, maize, wheat, peas, thread, wool, seeds, sugar, rice and to cover the cost of growing cress and vegetables.

They will use their savings to increase the capital of their businesses, start to raise guinea pigs and thereby increase their profits.

The members' dream is to see their businesses grow, to have a guinea pig farm, to have a shop, and that their kids study and get good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Banco Comunal “Hatun Ayllu D. Aqchapa” es un banco joven. Actualmente tiene 2 ciclos y 16 socias. Las socias del Banco Comunal son pobladores D. L. comunidad D. Aqchapa que pertenece al distrito D. Quinua, L. actividad económica que realizan son L. agricultura y L. ganadería. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. agricultura, venta D. verduras, crianza D. animales, venta D. ganados, cereales, tejido D. mantas, venta D. abarrotes. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 8,850 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. cuyes para crianza, ganado vacuno, maíz, trigo, arveja, hilos, lanas, semillas, azúcar, arroz y para los gastos D. L. siembra D. alfalfa, verduras. Sus ahorros lo utilizaran en incrementar el capital D. sus negocios, implementar galpones D. crianza D. cuyes y engorD. D. ganado Los sueños D. las socias es que sus negocios crezcan, tener una granja D. crianza D. cuyes, tener una botica, que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.

loans.use: The loans will be invested in buying guinea pigs for raising, buying cows, maize, wheat, peas, thread, wool, seeds, sugar, rice and to cover the cost of growing cress and vegetables/Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra de cuyes para crianza, ganado vacuno, maíz, trigo, arveja, hilos, lanas, semillas, azúcar, arroz y para los gastos de la siembra de alfalfa, verduras.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a married woman with four children, ages 28, 23,19 and 16 years old. She and her husband also take care of another 4-year-old child.

Felista sells charcoal, which she started doing in 2005. Everyday she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs Yat P., 47, and her husband, Mr Chanthorn But, 48, were married in 1987 and have two daughters. Both of their daughters are married, one lives outside the family home. Her daughter and her son-in-law are silk weavers. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Yat has been a silk weaver since 1980. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh.

Now she is requesting a loan of US$550 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business and some amount for her daughter’s weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Pham, 46 years old, has two children living with her. The children are attending school, while her husband is working abroad in Russia. Every household duty, including taking care of the children, is done by her own two hands. Even with the heavy load of family duties, she also runs a general store. The retail sales with daily revenues is a very good fit with borrowing money and repaying it on a weekly basis. She joined the Fund from its very beginning, the loans from the Fund were always put towards buying more goods to sell. The general store brings an average daily income of 100,000 VND a day. In this round of funding she is requesting 7,000,000 VND to buy more stock goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer

Chị Phạm Thị Đoan 46 tuổi, chị có 2 con đang sống cùng chị các con của chị đang đi học, chồng chị đi xuất khẩu lao động tại nước nga. Mọi công việc gia đình, chăm sóc con cái đều do đôi bàn tay của chị. Với nhiều công việc gia đình như vậy xong chị vẫn mở một của hàng tạp hóa, việc kinh doanh bán hàng tạp hóa cho thu nhập hàng ngày là rất phù hợp cho việc vay vốn trả tuần, chị tham gia vào Quỹ ngay từ những ngày đầu, vốn vay của Quỹ đều đựoc chị đầu tư vào mua các mặt hàng. Từ việc kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa này thu nhập bình quân gia đình chị 100.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 7.000.000 để mua thêm hàng hóa.

loans.use: Buy more stock for general store

loans.name: Honronya (L’Indépendance) Group

texts.fr:
The members of Honronya group are on average 25 years old and have an average of 4 children each. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands and children in the village of Sikouna 1, Fana Sous-Prefecture, (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

The group sells various items: charcoal and especially condiments (smoked fish, dried fish, spices, salt, etc.)

They are linked to each other by ties of profession, neighborhood, and friendship.

Their solidarity being firmly established, the members of Honronya have decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso, which has just approved their first group loan. Their purchasing is done via wholesalers coming from Bamako, generally on market days as far as the condiments are concerned, and, as for charcoal, in surrounding villages. They sell their merchandise either out of their homes, or at the market, or as ambulant salespeople. Their sales are generally made retail on a cash basis, especially at the market, and on credit to neighbors in the village.

The members of the Honronya group, by buying with this loan 10 sacks of charcoal, 5 kg of smoked fish, 10 kg of dried fish, and big quantities of spices, expect to make an average monthly profit of 7500 FCFA which will be mostly reinvested in their businesses.

In future, these women of the Honronya group hope to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Les membres du groupe Horonya, âgés de 25 ans avec 4 enfants en moyenne vivent dans des familles élargies traditionnelles avec leurs époux et enfants dans le village de Sikouna 1 sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.)

Le groupe fait le commerce d’articles divers : de charbon de bois et surtout les condiments alimentaires (poisson fumé, séché, épices sel de cuisine etc.)

Elles sont essentiellement unies par des liens professionnels de voisinage et d’amitié.

La solidarité du groupe ne souffrant d’aucune faille les membres de Horonya ont décidé de travailler avec Soro Yiriwaso qui leurs a octroyé leur premier prêts de groupe ce mois ci .L’approvisionnement de ce groupe se fait auprès des grossistes venant de Bamako, généralement les jours de foire pour les condiments et dans les villages environnants pour le charbon de bois. Elles viennent vendre leurs articles suivant les cas à la maison soit au marché soit de façon ambulante .Les ventes de ce groupe se font généralement en détail au comptant au niveau du marché surtout, et à crédit aux voisins du village.

Les membres du groupe Horonya en achetant avec ce prêt 10 sacs de charbon de bois 5 kg de poisson fumé 10 kg de poisson séché et importante quantité d’épices comptent réaliser bénéfice un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 7500CFA qui serviront essentiellement à l’investissement dans l’activité.

Ces femmes de Horonya envisagent devenir des grossistes.

loans.use:
Purchase of various items for re-sale

Achat de divers articles

loans.name: Thi Ly

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Ly, 40 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007 with the goal of improving her family's financial situation. Her first loan of 5,000,000VND (312.50USD) was used to invest in rearing pigs. Realizing the high profit gained, her family decided to renovate the pig sty to continue rearing pigs in a large scale. Since then, her family members have been putting more effort into work. Her husband also works as a construction worker with the monthly income of 2,000,000VND (125USD). Mrs. Ly sometimes works as cleaner for the village's administration house for the monthly income of 1,000,000VND (62.50USD). With these stable incomes, her family has always been able to repay the loan fully. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to invest in rearing pigs. Her family's average monthly income is 4,000,000VND (250USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Lý 40 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007 với mục đích vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay 5000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, sau 1 vòng vốn vay thấy rằng việc chăn nuôi sẽ đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế, gia đình chị đã bàn bạc sửa chữa lại toàn bộ chuồng trại để tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi với mô hình lớn hơn. Từ khi tham gia vốn các thành viên trong gia đình đều cố gắng hơn trong công việc, chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây nên công việc của anh cũng rất đều đặn thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng 2.000.000đ, chị làm vệ sinh môi trường tại ủy ban xã công việc tranh thủ nhưng lương mỗi tháng 1.000.000đ. Với thu nhập ổn định như vậy nên việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đình luôn hoàn thành tốt. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La venta de queso es el sustento principal de Rosa, joven empeñosa de 23 años de edad, con muchísimas ganas de prosperar en la vida, se viene dedicando a este oficio desde hace 2 años, empezó apoyando a sus hermanos mayores, pero al aprender rápidamente, decidió hacer de este oficio, su principal ingreso económico.Adquiere su mercadería los fines de semana en los diferentes pueblitos aledaños de la ciudad donde vive, Juliaca, para luego enviarlas al por mayor al mercado de la ciudad de Arequipa, donde tiene gran clientela asegurada.Esta actividad de compra y venta de queso le está permitiendo cubrir  satisfactoriamente sus estudios de contabilidad, ahora, el deseo que tiene esta joven es contar con mayor capital para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
The sale of cheese is the main source of income of Rosa, a young and hardworking 23-year-old woman with a lot of dreams for her future. She started working in this business two years ago, when she began supporting her older brothers. As she learned more, she decided making this activity her principal source of revenue. During the weekends she buys the cheese in different small towns around Juliaca, in order to sell large quantities of this product to the city of Arequipa, where the demand for cheese is large. This selling and buying of cheese has allowed her to cover the costs of studying accounting; now, the dream of this young woman is to invest in her business and see it grow.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business of selling cheese

loans.name: Mamah

texts.fr: Mamah A. est exerce l’activité de boucherie à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 35 ans, Mamah est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il souhaite avec ce crédit, le deuxième de FECECAV, acheter des bœufs, des boucs, des béliers pour l’abattage et aussi disposer d’un troupeau de moutons
texts.en:
Mamah A. is a butcher in Danyi, a village located approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Mamah, age 35, is married and the father of 4 children. With this loan, the second with FECECAV, he wishes to buy beefs, goats, and sheep for slaughter, and also to have a sheep flock to maintain.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beefs, goats, and sheep for slaughter, and also to have a sheep flock to maintain

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es: La señora Hilda habita en el barrio Primavera, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 47 años de edad, se encuentra soltera, pero  recibe una pensión por parte del padre de sus,  donde tiene dos hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad, ambos son estudiantes. Actualmente la señora Hilda se desempeña como empleada domestica, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, donde requiere  seguir esforzándose para obtener un nivel de vida mejor, al igual de poder apoyar a sus pequeños hijos en su formación educativa. La Sra. Hilda requiere de un financiamiento para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, donde esta necesitando la cantidad de C$ 15,000  aun plazo de 12 meses, para cambiar las puertas de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado.
texts.en:
Ms. Hilda lives in the town of Primavera, a town in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is 47-years old and is single. She receives child support payments from the father of their two children, who are 13 and 10 years old. Both children are students. In actuality, Ms. Hilda currently serves as a maid and has been working in this capacity for the past 8-years, though it will take more on her part to achieve a better standard of living, like providing support for her little children’s formative education. Ms. Hilda requires funding for home improvements, where she’ll need a loan in the amount of C$15,000 to be repaid in 12-months, to change the doors of her home as they are currently in bad condition.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two doors for her house.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom A. is a farmer, and she lives in Trapaing Suom village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She now faces an obstacle in that she usually pays a lot of money to have her field plowed. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy an ox to help her old ox plow the field, to reduce her family's expense. Her husband, Mr. Ya Seiv An, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sokhom A. is 41 years old and the mother of six children -- one of whom is a farmer, while another four are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy an ox to help her old one plow the field to reduce her family's expense.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El Señor de nombre Juan Bautista M. L. tiene la edad de 54 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Don Juan tiene 3 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor tiene 31 años de edad  y trabaja por cuenta propia, su otro hijo de 29 años de edad y trabaja por cuenta propia y su hijo de 10 años de edad que cursa el 4 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como comerciante, sus propósitos son de crecer para su vida personal y en su negocio, sus deseos son cambiar de unidad para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y sus sueños son que Dios le sigua suministrando mas vida para seguir adelante y llevara cabo sus propósitos.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es taxista, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante por lo que tiene que recorrer las calles de León en busca de clientes, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 13 años, sus inicios se dan por cuenta propia por lo que tenia que buscar el medio de ganar dinero y a la edad e 22 años empieza manejando camión y logro quedarse con este trabajo por un buen tiempo pero debido a unos problemas con su esposa lo llevan al fracaso y lo embargan y con la ayuda de unos amigos que le brindaron el apoyo necesario logra salir adelante y obtiene una unidad de taxi y es así como consigue este trabajo, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que esta destinado para la reparación general de su vehiculo y para los diferentes compromisos contraídos ya que agradece también a Fundación y las diferentes organizaciones que hagan posible esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Bautista M. L. is 54 and lives with his significant other. Don Juan has 3 children: his oldest son is 31 and works independently, his middle son is 29 and works independently, and his 10-year-old son is in fourth grade. His life companion is a saleswoman. Juan's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels the streets of León in search of customers. He has owned his business for 13 years. He started with his own funds in search of a way to earn money. At the age of 22, he started driving a truck and made a living with this work for quite awhile. But due to some problems with his wife, they split up and they seized the truck. With the help of some friends, they gave him the necessary support to keep going and to obtain a taxi, and he continues with this work. The financing will go towards general repairs of his vehicle and towards different contractual obligations. He thanks Fundación León and the different organizations that make this help possible.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es: El grupo "San Miguel" esta representado por la señora Karen y conformada por 15 miembros D. los cuales una mayoría se dedican a la actividad comercial D. productos como  ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos por catalogo, embutidos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y a actividades como el servicio dental, elavoracion D. pan e instalacion D. gas. Los socios (as) saben D. la gran competencia que existe en el mercado en especial en el rubro del comercio donD. los precios varian D. acuerdo a la demanda D. los consumidores y donD. se tiene que tener un producto acorD. a las necesidades y a un precio bajo para que pueda ser considerado competitivo; es por esta razon que los Socios (as) destinaran los fondos otorgados por la Fundacion Agrocapital para la compra D. mejores materiales e insumos para tener productos competitivos y D. buena calidad para incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Para una mayoría D. los socios D. este grupo el trabajar con grupos solidarios es algo nuevo pero cada uno esta conciente D. la responsabilidad y el trabajo duro que se necesita para poder cumplir con sus compromisos en especial para con su grupo.
texts.en:
The "San Miguel" group is represented by Señora Karen and consists of 15 members, the majority of which dedicate themselves to commercial activities, selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics via catalogues, sausages and groceries in neighbourhood stalls. Others are in dental services, bread-making and the installation gas systems.

The members know that there is great competition in the market, especially in the commercial area where prices vary according to consumer demand and where one must have a product that is needed and at a low price so that it can be considered competitive. For this reason, the members have determined the destiny of the funds raised from Fundacion Agrocapital will be to purchase better materials and components in order to have competitive, good quality products so that they may increase their revenue and better their families’ quality of life.

For the majority of this group, working within sympathetic groups is a new experience, but each is conscious of the responsibility and the hard work that needs to be done in order to fulfill their obligations, especially to the group.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo U. owns a rice farm. He learned to grow rice from his parents. Now that he has his own family, he works his best to increase his yield to support the needs of his child well. He is 48 years old and has only 1 child. He wants to send his child to school. His harvest is what he depends on for the future of his family. Almost all of his harvest is saved for family consumption, while the remainders are sold to some rice traders in their village.

He is requesting a loan from CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner) for Php 12, 000. He will use the loan to buy the necessary fertilizers, herbicides and other chemicals for his farm. His loan will truly give Eduardo better harvest. In this way, he will have more to give to his family.

CEVI is helping people to start and grow their businesses. By joining in the CEVI program, more people accessed the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and molluscide

loans.name: Shakuntala

texts.en: Shakuntala is 57 years old and a new member of ASHI. She has been married for eight years and has been blessed with seven children. Four of them are college graduates and the others are still in school. Her first loan amounting to $125 will be her starting capital for vegetable vending and for buying and selling herbal medicines. Shakuntala will purchase a variety of vegetables to sell to customers in her neighborhood and in surrounding townships. She dreams that this business will expand so that she can open stalls in other places. Eventually she would like to build her own house where her family can live comfortably.

loans.use: To buy a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of flour, sugar, onions, yeast and an oven.

loans.name: Julián

texts.es: Julián de 28 años de edad, vive hace 5 años con su pareja con la que tiene 2 hijos, hace unos meses vivían en la casa de sus suegros, pero ahora está muy feliz de mudarse a su casa propia. Desde muy niño le han gustado las labores agrícolas, cuando su padre alistaba las yuntas para arar sus chacras él se emocionaba mucho, porque su reto era domar a los toros para arar cada una de las chacras. Ahora convertido en un hombre muy responsable, cada uno de sus cultivos los realiza con mucho cariño y esmero. En años anteriores se dedicaba mayormente a la siembra de papa, pero por falta de presupuesto aminoró la cantidad y ahora siembra más alverjas porque este cultivo le resulta más rentable. Además, cuando tiene tiempo aprovecha en trabajar en los cultivos de sus vecinos, quienes le pagan de 18 a 20 soles diarios, con este dinero cubre los gastos de la canasta familiar, mientras que el dinero de las cosechas lo guarda para que vuelva a sembrar. Los sueños de Julián son de mejorar su situación económica e implementar su hogar con los artículos básicos necesarios. Julián es una persona callada en las reuniones de su banco comunal, quien siempre opina es su  esposa. Este es el 7mo préstamo consecutivo que viene trabajando con MFP, y en todo este tiempo no caído en morosidad. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para el abonado de su chacra de alverjas.
texts.en:
Julián is 28 and has lived with his wife for 5 years. They have 2 children together. A few months ago, they lived in his inlaws' house, but now he is very happy to have moved to their own house. Since he was very young, he has liked working in agriculture. When his father prepared the oxen to plow his land, he got very excited because his job was to break in the bulls to plow each one of the plots of land. Now he is a very responsible man, and he grows his crops with a lot of care. In previous years, he mainly grew potatoes, but because they weren't very profitable, he lessened the quantity that he grew of them and now grows more peas because they are more profitable. Also, when he has time, he helps his neighbors with their crops, and they pay him 18 to 20 PEN every day. With this money, he can cover the cost of his family's food and he can put the money from his harvests towards the next season's planting. Julián's dream is to improve his economic situation and to furnish his home with the basic necessary items. Julián is quiet in his communal bank's meetings; his wife is the one who always voices her opinion. This is his seventh consecutive loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. In all this time he has not defaulted. The money that he is requesting will go towards buying fertilizer for his pea crop.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en:
Maryline A. O. is a 28-year-old mother of five children, ages 9, 7, 4, 2 and a half, and 6 months. She sells second-hand clothes that she purchases from wholesalers in the Kiubye market, Kisumu’s largest open air market. On average, Maryline says she makes 4,000 KSH a week and sometimes more on Sunday, market day. She is married to a businessman but they want to set up another account dedicated to her business. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to buy more stock. If she makes enough profit, she would like to start selling shoes, purchased from Dubai. She hopes to send her children through university because, “that is the good life."

Maryline recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Clothing Stocks, Shoes

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela. They are blessed with three children who are all now attending school. Regina hopes to sustain her vending business because it is where she gets most of the money to pay for her children’s education.

Regina runs a vending business where she sells products including snacks, vegetables and cooked foods/viands. She is requesting a loan to support the development of her vending business. She is requesting around PHP 4,000 only. She is planning to add more products to sell, which will allow her to increase her daily income. She usually generates an average income of PHP 400 a day. She dreams of seeing her children have a good life someday and this will become possible if she can continue to finance their studies through college. She believes she can do this by working hard and having patience to succeed.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es:
La señora Celinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas II”, vive en el Jr. Carlos Mariátegui Nº 250, Distrito de Nueva Cajamarca, Provincia Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 39 años tiene 5 hijos, todos aun en etapa escolar.  

Motivada por sus ganas de sacar adelante a su familia  y gracias a su espíritu y energía emprendedora, inicio su negocio con un capital de S/. 300.00 vendiendo  artículos para el hogar como, ollas de aluminio, platos y  tasas de loza, jarra y vasos de vidrio, bandejas de plástico entre  otros, productos que los ofrece en las ferias o festividades que se realizan en las distintas comunidades aledañas a la ciudad de Nueva Cajamarca, sitios  que recorre junto a su esposo donde son muy conocidos por los buenos productos y por los cómodos precios que venden. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará  juegos de ollas de aluminio de 12 y 7 piezas de varias marcas, 6 docenas de platos de loza, tazas, 5 docenas de jarras y vasos de vidrio, 4 docenas de bandejas de plástico de distintos  tamaños para así mantener a su clientela satisfecha porque   encontrará  en su negocio los productos que buscan.
 
Se siente muy contenta, ya que pese a las dificultades supo salir adelante junto a su familia, por lo que reconoce y agradece el apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres, que quieren emprender su negocio y salir adelante solas, sin depender de nadie.
texts.en:
Celinda belongs to “Las Violetas II” Communal Bank. She lives at Nº 250 Carlos Mariátegui St., in Nueva Cajamarca, Rioja province, Department of San Martín. She is 39 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their 5 children, who are all in school. Motivated by her desire to support her family, and thanks to her energy and enterprising nature, Celinda started her business with 300.00 soles in capital. She sells household products such as aluminum pots, china plates and cups, glasses, glass jugs, plastic trays, etc. Celinda sells these products at street markets and festivities, which take place in the various communities near the city of Nueva Cajamarca. She and her husband travel to these communities together, and they are known in these places for their good products and their reasonable prices. Celinda will use this loan of 800.00 soles to purchase 12 sets of aluminum pots, 7 pieces of various types, 6 dozen china plates and cups, 5 dozen glasses and glass jugs, and 4 dozen plastic trays of different sizes. These products will allow her to keep her clientele satisfied, since she will have everything her customers are looking for. Celinda feels very happy, since despite the difficulties, she knows that she and her family will be able to get ahead. She recognizes and appreciates the support that the Manuela Ramos organization has given to her and to other women who want to start businesses and succeed on their own, without being dependent on anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products to increase her stock.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Teresa es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Teresa vende materiales de construcción como ladrillos, agregados, en un local alquilado, además Teresa tiene carros con los cuales brinda servicios de transporte de agregados.
Teresa necesita un préstamo de 3200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arena y pago del personal.
Los sueños de Teresa son que sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio y comprar otro carro mas.
texts.en:
Teresa is member of the Carnations Communal Bank group. She is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children. She sells building materials, such as bricks and cement, from a rented space. In addition, Teresa offers a delivery service and owns vehicles used for transporting cement.

Teresa needs 3200 soles so that she can purchase sand and pay her employees. She dreams of expanding her business, purchasing another vehicle, and having her children pursue professional careers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand and pay employees

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Doña Juana Maria es una mujer esforzada que desde muy joven a ayudado a sus padres para sobresalir en la vida, se caso desde joven y procreo dos hijos de 9 y 11 años de edad, tiene 42 años y reside en el barrio 380 en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en la alcaldía, inicio a vende tortillas y frijoles cosidos, para poder a poyar a su esposo con los gastos. Sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa con este crédito quiere comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un aumento del porche y poder estar en condiciones mejores. Da las gracias a la institución por los objetivos alcanzados.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Maria is a strong woman who, from a very young age, helped her parents get ahead in life. She married at a young age and now has 2 children, ages 9 and 11. She is 42 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her husband is a city employee.

She began selling tortillas and beans in order to help her husband with the household expenses. She plans to make some improvements to her house. With her loan, she will buy construction materials to enlarge her porch and make other repairs to improve her living conditions. She thanks the institution for helping her meet her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Gani

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Бердыев Гани -40летний мужчина,женат.Имеет 4х детей-двоих сыновей и 2их дочек.Его жена Бердыева Гульбахор работает медсестрой в районной поликлинике.Гани сам мастер по ремонту лекговых автомобилей,с детства увлекался машинами и вот стал мастером.В районе его услуга пользуется большим спросом, так как каждый второй или третий владеет собственным автомобилем.Гани ремонтирует все виды автомобилей и зарабатывает в среднем 50 сом. в день.Узнав про нашу организацию он решил обратиться за кредитом,чтобы закупить по оптовой цене запчасти.Он обучает своих сыновей своему делу и планирует в будущем открыть для них новую точку техобслуживания.
texts.en:
Gani B. is a 40-year-old man, who is married and has 4 children - two sons and two daughters. His wife, Gulbahor Berdyeva, works as a nurse at a district hospital. Gani is a master car mechanic. He loved cars since childhood and became a mechanic. His services are in high demand in the district because every second or third person has their own car. Gani repairs all types of cars and earns an average of 50 somoni per day. Having learnt about our organization, he decided to request a loan in order to buy spare parts wholesale. He teaches the business to his sons and plans to open a new auto repair shop for them in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es: Nolberta es una agricultora de 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Ya tiene 6 años de arduo trabajo en las tareas del campo, cultiva principalmente el tubérculo nativo de su zona que es la papa, la cual después de 6 meses de espera la vende en los principales mercados de abastos de las ciudades más aledañas de su localidad. Paralelamente a esta actividad Nolberta cría animales, los cuales vende y también son para su propio consumo. Todos los miembros de su familia realizan estas tareas, así reducen los gastos de contratar a peones para la siembra o cosecha. A pesar de los momentos de dificultades, su sentido de perseverancia la ha llevado mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas cada vez más, fortaleciendo la calidad de la tierra, y también para incrementar su ganado vacuno. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por ello Nolberta confía en seguir realizando un trabajo responsable, solidario y honesto en su banco comunal. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará sacos de abono, fertilizantes y ganado ovino.
texts.en:
Nolberta is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. For the past six years, she has been engaged in arduous work cultivating potatoes that are native to this area. Once the crops are planted, she must wait six months before she can sell her harvest in the major markets that supply the surrounding cities. At the same time, Nolberta breeds animals for sale and for personal consumption. All of her family members perform work around their farm, which reduces their costs of hiring laborers for planting and harvesting. Even though she has experienced difficult times, Nolberta’s perseverance has helped to improve the quality of her crops, the productivity from her land, and the size of her cattle herds.

This is the third time Nolberta has requested a loan from MFP. She pledges to continue working responsibly, as well as being honest and supportive of her fellow Communal Bank members. The money she requested will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer and heads of sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer & heads of sheep

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a member of the Miembeni borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 42 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 18,14,9, and 7 years old.

Fatuma has owned a clothing business selling clothes  for 12 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a mothnly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Fatuma`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan. Fatuma hopes to pay school fees. get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta owns a small shop in Kisumu where she sells blouses, skirts, shirts, pants and coats. She has requested her fourth loan from SMEP for KES 80,000 in order to increase her stock from markets in Nairobi and Busia. Jacinta’s shop is a roadside stall, not a permanent structure, and therefore business is often disrupted by rain. She would therefore like to one day move her business to a permanent shop in the city center. Jacinta is a mother of a 5-year old girl and describes herself as hard-working and polite.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Orshikh

texts.en: Orshikh T. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son and daughter attend a local secondary school and her youngest son is in kindergarten. T. operates a grocery trading business in her town. She started her business in 1998 with the help of her husband and has steadily grown her business over the years. In 2009, T. began growing and selling her own vegetables. She rented a field and was able to plant and harvest nearly 4 tons of potatoes and 5 tons of carrots. Next year, she is planning to have her own 7 hectare field. T. is working hard to further grow her business and improve her family's quality of life. She is requesting a 2,500.000 tugrug (~1750 USD) loan to purchase 5 tons of beets and 5 tons of cabbage to sell in her grocery trading business.

loans.use: To purchase 5 tons of beets and 5 tons of cabbage to sell in her grocery trading business

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta L. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Violeta is widowed and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta runs a business in the service sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services to community members with her pedicab vehicle. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Violeta joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Violeta is requesting the same amount (that is, 11,000 PHP), which will be used to purchase materials to improve her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Violeta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing materials to improve her business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina T. is from the village of Punta. She is 48 years old, is married, and has eight adult children. Catalina owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Catalina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen, a 29 year-old married woman with one child, lives in Gaza, Palestine, where she owns a shop selling home appliances and kitchenware.

Today she is requesting a loan of $2,000 to buy more inventory to increase her client base. She says, "thank you!"

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of entrepreneur. In Palestine, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is married with 7 children and she is 54 years old. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She sells used clothes in the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. The demands for her used clothes are high by those in her community that cannot afford new clothes. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more  used clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Ngang J

texts.en:
Rose was born 08/07/1966. She is married to Angoudu Emmanuel and has three kids below 15 years of age. Being a hard working lady, she has faced so many challenges in life including ill health and being unable to take care of her children. Due to all of these challenges, she made up her mind to become a GHAPE member in the year 2008.I n this same year, she received her pioneer loan of 40,000FRS, and the repayment was done promptly. 
         With a loan of 200,0000FRS, she plans to buy seven tins of corn, five tins of beans, 4 tins of garri, and 5 buckets of cocoyams. The loan repayment will start from the day the loan is disbursed. She is sure the business will succeed because she has been doing this business for a long  time.
