She has a good location for her business and she has a lot of customers. Her neighbors are happy the business is located next door because they don't have to go far to the market and can buy from her late at night. She plans to use the profits to plough back into the business, cater for her son, and give good medical attention to herself and her children. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the social services GHAPE offers and the convenient method of repayment.
             The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy and sell corn, beans, garri, and cocoyams.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin L., 44, is married and lives with her three children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband, pictured here, works as a moto-taxi driver making $5 each day. Yin L. would like to take out a loan of $1000. Her husband needs to purchase a motorbike to operate as a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To buy a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
K. Ulugbek is a 33-year-old married man with 4 children and parents under his care. Ulugbek is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased sheep and this motivated him to start his own business 5 years ago. Over time, he has increased his sheep sales and he is proud to say that the business has been running well. Now Ulugbek needs additional capital to expand and is requesting a loan in the amount of $2200 USD to purchase additional sheep to sell. More specifically, he will reinvest the loan proceeds and grow the business, as he has been doing. Ulugbek and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and give their children a better quality of life.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the sheep to expand the business.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a mother of a 16 year-old child.  She is 48 years old and has been married to Roberto for 27 years.  Luzminda ventured in rice farming several years ago and now has two hectares of rice field.  She helps her husband maintain their farm.  She makes sure it is free of weeds and pests so their crops would grow healthy.  Luzminda hopes to have her child finish college and has a bright future.

Luzminda needs additional capital for her business.   That’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc.  She is happy to have access to its program and is now requesting to loan Php4,000, which she would use to buy farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn G. is from the village of Banquero. She is 35 years old. Jocelyn is the group leader of a seven member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jocelyn G.'s Group.

Jocelyn is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns a pharmacy business which provides medicines to local community members. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jocelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: El Gato Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Gato es un nuevo grupo que está integrado por  cuatro personas trabajadoras quienes desean mejorar sus negocios ellos son Dulce María F.,  Deyanira del Carmen G. V., Jorge Antonio M. W. y Xiomara del Socorro V. S..

La coordinadora del grupo es la señora F. quien vende cosméticos desde hace tres años cuyo negocio comenzó con unos ahorros y el cual ha ido creciendo es por ello que necesita el crédito para surtir a sus clientes. 
Sus compañeros de grupo son; Deyanira del Carmen G. V. quien vende cosméticos, Jorge Antonio M. W. tiene una pulpería  y Xiomara del Socorro V. S. es dueña de una estética de belleza.
texts.en:
The “El Gato” (The Cat) group is a new group and is composed of four, hard-working persons who wish to improve their businesses: Dulce María F., Deyanira del Carmen G. V., Jorge Antonio M. W. and Xiomara del Socorro V. S.. Mrs. F. is the group coordinator; she has sold cosmetics for the last three years. She began her business using some of her savings and she has gradually been increasing it. She needs funds to be able to supply her customers. Her fellow group members are Deyanira del Carmen G. V., who sells cosmetics, Jorge Antonio M. W., who has a grocery store, and Xiomara del Socorro V. S., who owns a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Reneda

texts.en:
Reneda Q. is from the city of Gala Ozamiz city. She is 56 years old. Reneda is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Reneda owns & operates a business planting & harvesting vegetables for sale such as "kangkong, alogbati" and etch. Reneda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Reneda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reneda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Reneda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Reneda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Group Of Family

texts.en: Cecelia K., holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Group of Family. She is 60 years old, married with five children. Cecelia did not have the opportunity to go to school due to lack of funds. For 30 years she has sold fish on a table at the Jacob Town market in Paynesville, Liberia. Cecelia gives good service to customers to keep them returning. She started selling with a loan from her family. Cecelia lacks good shelter in the market hall for her business. Her goal and dream is to own a shop to increase her profit. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more fish.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. sells both local and imported drugs in her pharmacy at Takoradi. She has received a junior high educational background. She is married and has three wonderful children. Her husband is a carpenter.

Beatrice has been selling drugs for quite some time now, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more drugs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mr. Yun Y. is a villager in Trapeang Chak village in Prey Veng province. He is 44 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Pao Phun (who appears in the photo with him), are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. His child helps him on the farm. On the side, Mr. Yun Y. also works as a construction worker.
The problem with his land is that the soil is infertile. So to improve production, Mr. Yun Y. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza R. is from the village of San  Pedro. She is 48 years old. Liza is married and has 3 children The eldest is an adult while  the remaining 2 are school-aged. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a business venture in the  Aqua-Culture sector, culturing oysters. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from oyster culture knows as "Talaba" in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP average a month for these activities.

In 2007, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials for oyster culture activities. Liza is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Liza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business of oyster culture

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya D. is 65 years old and lives with her husband in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger'- a traditional housing tent. Her husband works as a guard and earns 250,000 MNT in salary per month. 

Enhtuya operates a food retailing business out of a small shop. She started her business in 2008 with the working capital of 300,000 MNT and since then, it has increased 10 times. Over the years she has worked hard to build a stable business operation and has gained much experience. Her business is very important to her and her family. She says, "My only wish is to enlarge the business and purchase a bigger house than the one we live in now." 

Enhtuya is an open-minded, easy-going and hard-working woman. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 33 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jeane owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also runs a sari-sari store where basic daily needs are sold. She hopes to have a stable income so she can sustain her children's education.

Jeane joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeane has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jeane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and store supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jeane from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and store supplies.

loans.name: Juntas Si Podemos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Juntas si Podemos inicia su ciclo 6, las socias son de la Provincia de Huanta y realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso de la Señora Alejandra que es casada y tiene 8 hijos que son estudiantes, Alejandra tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, sus productos los adquiere en algunas oportunidades de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Alejandra se dedica a la compra de tara, cochinilla y lúcuma, pues la región donde vive es productora de estos productos, luego los comercializa a intermediarios, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de tara, cochinilla.
Los sueños de Alejandra son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The community bank named Together We Can has started its 6th loan cycle. The members are originally from the Huanta province and they all carry out different types of businesses. Alejandra is married and she is the mother of 8 children, all are attending school. Alejandra runs a grocery stO. from her home. She acquires her products from other businesses in the city of Ayacucho. Alejandra is also buys and sells tare, cochineal and lucuma fruit. The region where they live is a large producer of these products. She sells them to retail stores. This loan will be invested in the purchase of tare and cochineal. Alejandra's dream is to see her children complete their schooling and see them in their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tare and cochineal.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 15 years and has employed one farmhand. He sells his eggs to a local shop. He also earns income from his pension and from the sale of bananas.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand his poultry farming. He says that this loan will help improve the family's lifestyle. His major challenges have been competition and a lack of sufficient capital to expand his business.

Peter is 60 years old. He is married and has been blessed with three children, who are all now adults. He is very optimistic that he will succeed in his poultry business.

He comments that Juhudi products have really improved unlike before.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farming

loans.name: German

texts.es: Germán tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Germán, sostiene que en un mundo de negocios, “las relaciones son muy importantes, ya que determina el éxito de la persona”, bajo esa frase, empezó a congeniarse con sus clientes potenciales, como clientes nuevos, con el propósito de que pueda ofrecer las bondades de su producto de café, de la cual le resultaba buenos ingresos económicos. No contento con ello, incursionó en otro negocio, con la necesidad de que pueda diferenciarse antes sus demás competencia, es así que tienen una tienda de abarrotes, actividad que se hace cargo su querida esposa. En ocasiones trata de ayudar en este nuevo negocio, ya que más tiempo pasa en sus cultivos de café, en donde trabaja de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 del mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde y su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad. Normalmente recibe la ayuda de su familia, pero en tiempo de cosecha tiene a cargo de sus peones, ya que de esa manera permitirá que extraigan su producto final. Su plan a futuro es incursionar en otra actividad, como la venta de ropa, con el propósito de sus ingresos aumenten de manera considerable, y a la vez tenga una buena calidad de vida. Este es su segunda cuota con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contento con su banco comunal, ya que le permite ahorrar, fruto de las ganancias que percibe en su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías, de esa manera podrá implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Germán is 38 years old, married, and has three children. They live in the town of Quimbiri, located in the beautiful Peruvian rainforest, where they have their own house made of wood. Germán says that, in the world of business, “Relationships are very important, as it is these that will determine how successful a person will be”. Germán began to associate with his potential clients with the aim of getting them interested in his coffee-selling business, from which he receives a good income. Not content with this, Germán made inroads into another business in order to distinguish himself from the competition. He therefore owns a grocery shop, which is managed by his beloved wife. Germán sometimes helps with this new business; however, he is normally busy cultivating his coffee plantations from Monday to Saturday, 7am till 6pm, and also sells his products in the locality. He normally receives help from his family, but during harvest time he relies on farm workers to assist him, which helps him with the entire harvesting process. Germán’s future plans include being able to sell clothes in order to substantially increase his income, whilst at the same time improve his standard of living. This is his second loan with MFP, and Germán promises to faithfully abide by the terms of the loan agreement. He is also happy with his community bank as it allows him to save from the profits of his business. With this loan, Germán wants to purchase merchandise for his shop and therefore be able to vary his wares.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ssulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman J. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. He has a business of selling clothes, which he has had for less than one year.         

To help expand his business, Sulaiman has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes to sell.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, he hopes to generate greater profits and improve on the family's standard of living. In the future, Sulaiman hopes to own a shop with his wife.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Eldar

texts.ru:
Eldar G. 48 let. On zamujem i imeyet 3 detey , doch kotoroy uje 19 let ona uchitsya v kolledje, sin kotoromu 17 let on uchitsya v shkole i sin kotoromu 15 let toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom. Eldar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy .

Eldar uje 7 let zanimayetsya etim biznessom skotovodstva , etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas Eldar nujdayetsya n 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi.
texts.en:
Eldar G. is 48 years old. He is married and has three children: a 19-year old daughter who is a college student, a 17-year old son who goes to school and a 15-years old son who also goes to school and participates in sports.  Eldar is an Internally Displaced Person; he is a refugee from the town of Fuzuli, now living in the Fuzuli Region.

Eldar has been raising cattle for 7 years. He learned it from his father. At present Eldar needs 2000 AZN in order to buy a cow.
.

loans.use: Purchasing a cow

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George C. K. is 39 years old, married and has two children, ages 12 and 5 years old. His business is located in a busy residential area of Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attractions – not forgetting the white beaches of the Indian ocean. 

George has been selling beds, cupboards and other such items to local people for the last 6 years. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more timber to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and also hopes to give his children a quality education and own a house some day. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munkhtsetseg is a 51-year-old widow living with her daughter and son-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter and son-in-law are students in local universities.   She owns a small piece of land with the family house in the suburb of the city.  Her eldest son lives separately with his family. 

In 1994, Munkhtsetseg started running a meat wholesale business together with her younger brother. They used to travel to countryside farms to buy meat and sell it in the city meat market. But since her brother passed away she was unable to travel to the countryside, and started a meat retail business. 

Her future plan is to give a good education for her kids and be able to pay university fees until their graduation. From the previous loan she has taken from us she bought a big freezer to store her meat products. This time she is requesting a loan to buy a small family car which will be used to carry her meat products.

loans.use: To buy a car to carry meat products.

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Batchimeg C. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd  province, western Mongolia, in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her husband works as a contractual guard in a local intelligence agency. After graduating from her university majoring in accounting, she started her business in 2009 by selling wool clothing items that are purchased from Goyo company, Mongolian biggest and main wool clothing company. In addition, she works as a salesperson in the local company to supplement her earnings. 

For the future, she plans to continue growing her business and open her own shop. Batchimeg says, " I want to buy my own house and fence for my family." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes from Goyo company to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: 03.07.06Dong Xuan Vi -Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ngoan L. T. (27) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Dong Xuan Vi-Hoang Hoa. Ngoan is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 03.07.06.Dong Xuan Vi-Hoang Hoa.

Ngoan is married with two school-aged children. She operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattL. for saL.. Ngoan has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2010, Ngoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. T. Nam (28) is a 23-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  P. T. Mien (29) is a 42-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


3.  D. T. Sam (30) is a 44-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


4.  B. T. Thanh (31) is a 26-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


5.  N. T. Hop (32) is a 39-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


6.  D. T. Thuan (33) is a 37-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ngoan L. T. (27) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố 03.07.06.Dong Xuan Vi -Hoang Hoa.  Ngoan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03.07.06 Dong Xuan Vi -Hoang Hoa (03.07.06 Dong Xuan Vi -Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Ngoan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 9 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, ngoan kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, ngoan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. T. Nam (28) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  P. T. Mien (29) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


3.  D. T. Sam (30) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


4.  B. T. Thanh (31) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


5.  N. T. Hop (32) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


6.  D. T. Thuan (33) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Julio Francisco

texts.es: Julio Francisco es un hombre muy responsable, por lo que siente muy contento con este medio de vida. El se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 17 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la manera de contribuir con su hogar.  El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa en general, adornos, calzado, perfumes y otras cosas que le han encargado. Quiere aprovechar esta temporada para ofrecer de todo.
texts.en:
Julio Francisco is a very responsible man, which is why he is very content with this way of life.

He sells general merchandise, and he has had this business for over 17 years.  That is why he is always looking for the way to contribute to his household.

The requested loan is to buy general clothing, decorations, footwear, perfume, and other things that have been ordered.  He wants to take advantage of this season in order to offer all types of things to sell.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Jargalsaihan B. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Bayanhoshuu of Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a house surrounded by a fence. His oldest daughter attends secondary school and his wife stays at home to care for their children.  Jargalsaihan supports his entire family by operating an iron crafting business in his town.  He produces a variety of steel/metal items according to his customers’ specification.  Before starting his iron craft business, Jargalsaihan operated a traditional Mongolian shoe-making business in his home starting in 2000. He started his metal business in 2005 and it has grown into a stable operation over the years.  He has expanded his business by hiring two to three workers.  He produces a variety of metal goods in his rented work place.  After years of hard work, he has gained a wide customer base. He needs own car for delivery iron. Because Jargalsaihan rented by car for delivery iron materials, which is a using to make metal goods, but it is expensive. In the future, he plans to enlarge his house and its surrounding fence so he can build a work space within his compound. Jargalsaihan is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a car for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car for his business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita B. is from the village of Bangahan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Teresita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Teresita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 7,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Jan Kloud

texts.en:
Jan Kloud is a 33-year-old married man, and the father of 3 children. He lives and works in Metn, where he has owned a bookstore for 8 years. He sells books, newspapers and stationary. Jan Kloud has a family to take care of so he must work hard to provide them with what they request.

Jan Kloud is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the second time in order to add new products to his business. He wants to start selling toys, gifts and gadgets. Jan Kloud believes that being hardworking helps in secure living, and that everyone must add something new to their business to attract new clients. Jan Kloud is a good standing borrower; he is welcome at anytime to request a loan from Al Majmoua, as most of his clients speak highly about his good manners. He hopes to develop his business more by adding new products.

loans.use: to add new products to his business

loans.name: Elourdes Maribel

texts.es:
La Señora. Elourdes Z. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive por el sector de la Feria Libre en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es admirada por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le permitió ser nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su belleza natural, su gastronomía muy variada y su gente amable y cordial hacen de Cuenca una ciudad bella.

Doña Elourdes tiene 36 años, es casada y  tiene 3 hijos de 21, 20 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia y viven arrendando.

La Señora Elourdes es comerciante de pollos actividad que la realiza hace 7 años, trabaja todos los días y cuenta con su clientela fija. También vende bisutería el tiempo que tiene libre.
 
Con el dinero de su crédito va a compra pollos y bisutería para continuar con este negocio. Es socia del banco comunal hace dos años y medio y su meta es comprarse un vehiculo para que le facilite su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Elourdes Z. is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun). She lives in the sector of Feria Libre in the city of Cuenca. This city is admired for its architectural beauty, which contributed toward its recognition as a World Heritage Site. The natural beauty, different cuisines, and the kind friendly people are all characteristics that make Cuenca a lovely city.

Doña Elourdes is 36 years old, married, and has three children (ages 21, 20, and 7). Her two older children are married and live independently. The youngest child attends school in the city. Her husband works as a merchant. They do not own a home and are currently living in a rental property.

Doña Elourdes has been selling chickens for seven years. She works every day and has an established customer base. In addition, she sells trinkets in her free time.

The money from her loan will be used to buy chickens and trinkets so that she can continue her businesses. Elourdes joined the Communal Bank two and a half years ago. Her goal is to buy a vehicle that she can use for work.

loans.use: Purchase chickens & trinkets to sell

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es:
Doña María D. 45 años D. edad,  resiD. en Concepción Batres, departamento D. Usulután, vive con su esposo y una hija D. 24 años D. edad, en la familia todos trabajan y ayudan con los gastos del hogar; doña María se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, esta negocio lo inicio debido a la necesidad D. trabajar y junto a su hija, trabaja en un horario D. 9:00am a 1:00pm, tiene una gran experiencia en el negocio y actualmente está solicitando un préstamo. 
Dicho préstamo le ayudara a comprar maíz, leña, gas, cal, estos materiales son los principales para preparar las tortillas y realizar las ventas diarias, esto le permitirá contar con todo lo necesario y atender la demanda D.  los clientes.
Su principal objetivo es tener un negocio prospero, aumentar su clientela y tener una familia unida con buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and resides in Concepcion Batres, Usulutan department, with her husband and 24-year-old daughter.  Everyone in the family works and helps with the household costs.

Maria makes and sells tortillas.  She began this business owing to the need to work, and alongsiD. her daughter, she labors from 9:00 am until 1:00 pm.  She has much experience in the business and presently, is soliciting a loan.

The loan will enable her to buy corn, firewood, gas, and lime, the principle materials needed to prepare tortillas and proviD. for her daily sales.  This will permit her to have all that is necessary for the business and to meet customer demand.

Her principal objective is to have a prosperous business, increase her clientèle, and have a united family living under good conditions.

loans.use: BUYING CORN, FIREWOOD, GAS, AND LIME TO MAKE TORTILLAS TO SELL

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena B.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for breeding. She is 47 years old, married and has one grown-up child. She is from the village of Rang-Ayan. Elena has been in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2007, Elena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elena is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 12th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 61 years old and married with five children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Nilda has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 38 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Nilda aspires to save for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Florita is 54 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Florita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Florita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Florita has been 5 years in this business.  In the future, Florita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkola, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de gâteaux, du lait et du haricot.                                                                                                                                 
Les femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter de la farine de blé, du lait et du haricot.                                                                          AMINATA T. compte acheter de la farine de blé avec les revendeurs au marché de Falako. Elle effectue ses ventes au village après préparation  des gâteaux, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 13000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, les frais de santé de ses enfants et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Benkola are all married, and they average 35 years of age and three children each living in traditional extended families in the village of Nalla, subprefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in cakes, milk, and bean. The group members are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used to buy wheat flour, milk, and beans.

Ms. AMINATA T. plans on buying wheat flour from the retailers at the Falako market. She makes her sales in the village after making the cakes. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 13,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to cover the cost of health care for the children. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour

loans.name: Rafaela Isabel

texts.es:
Rafaela tiene su propio negocio de venta de ropa y cosmético, así  como el alquiler de cuartos. El cual lo ha mantenido durante once años, todo esto lo ha logrado también con préstamo que la institución ha dado en ocho ciclos, como el apoyo económico de sus hijos el cual le envían  remesas. 
Hoy en día quiere hacer un cuarto más en la parte del fondo del patio con el objetivo de alquiler y poder obtener mejores ingresos que ayuden a estabilizar los gastos. Siendo este negocio rentable en la capital.
Así como en un futuro pasara a manos de sus hijos, y no tendrán que quedarse todo el tiempo fuera de su país natal.
Para comenzar comprara; piedra, arena, cemento, bloques y comenzar hasta donde pueda la construcción. Hasta terminarla por completa.
texts.en:
Rafaela has her own business, selling clothes and cosmetics, as well as renting rooms. She has done this for the past eleven years. All this was possible thanks to eight loan cycles with the microfinance institution Afodenic and thanks to financial support from her children who sent her remittances.

Now she wants to construct a further room in her courtyard for rental purposes. The additional income will help her to meet her household expenses. Room rental is a profitable business in the capital city. Later on, she will hand over her business to her children, who will not be forced to live permanently in a foreign country. To start the construction, she will buy stones, sand, cement and blocks. The loan will enable her to follow her construction project through to completion.

loans.use: to construct a new room for rental purposes.

loans.name: Kezia

texts.en:
Kezia is a 32 year-old Rwandan entrepreneur that sells clothes.  She has been selling clothes for five years and has used the profits from her success to build her family a house.

Kezia is married to a mechanic.  They have four children between the ages of five and 14 years old, and all of the children are in school.

She will use the loan to purchase more clothes that she will sell for her business, and the profits she generates will allow her to accumulate savings that will improve the future of herself and her family.

Kezia dreams of growing her business so that someday she can open her own store.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a lumber yard in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional lumber to sell.

Alejandra has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business further in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional lumber to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr:
L'emprunteur est un mécanicien marié polygamme et pére de 9 enfants; Sa fille ainée est éléve au Lycée alors que 2 de ses freres sont au college; quatres autres de ses enfants fréquentent l'école primaire. Le dernier né a 2 ans. Il tient un atelier de réparation mécanique dans sa localité non loin de la capitale. Il dépense 180 000f par mois pour nourrir ses femmes et ses enfants et aussi sa tante qui vit lui avec dans la maison familliale. Il paie les frais de scolarité des enfants(inscriptions, fournitures, habillement,transport)pour un montant de 280 000f. Cette année, il a été obligé de vendre un moteur destiné à son véhicule pour supporter ces frais. Il assure aussi les charges sanitaires de la famille. 
L'emprunteur est sociétaire de IMCEC depuis deux ans mais n' a jamais sollicité de prets. Il demande actuellement un crédit de  300 000 f pour réparer son taxi de transport urbain en achetant 4 portes , 1 capot, 2 ailes avant, 1 male arriere. Il veut en meme temps refaire la tolerie et la peinture pour rendre le taxi plus attractif aux clients. Cela lui permettra de faire face à la forte concurrence.
Son ambition est d'acheter d'autres véhicules de transport, de moderniser son atelier mécanique et d'y vendre des pieces de rechange.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married mechanic, polygamous and father of nine children. His eldest daughter is a student at the lycee while her brothers are in middle school. Four other children are enrolled in primary school. The last-born is two years old. 

The borrower has an auto repair shop in his place of residence, not far from the capital. He spends 180,000 francs a month to feed his wives and children as well as his aunt who lives with him in the family house. He pays school fees for the children (registration, school supplies, clothing, transport) for a total of 280,000 francs. This year he was obliged to sell a motor intended for his vehicle to cover these expenses. He also pays health expenses for the family. 

He has been a member of IMCEC for two years, but he has never asked for a loan. He is presently requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to repair his urban transport taxi by buying four doors, a hood, two front fenders and a trunk. At the same time he wants to redo the body and the paint job to make the taxi more attractive to clients. This will permit him to face the stiff competition. 

His ambition is to buy other transport vehicles, to update his auto repair shop, and to sell spare parts in his workshop.

loans.use: to repair his urban transport vehicle.

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Couturier de profession, Yawo a crée son salon de couture en 1996. A cette activité, il ajoute la vente des tissus, des matériels de couture (épingle, ruban, fermetures). Sa femme est revendeuse .Il a 39ans  et papa de 03 enfants.
texts.en: A clothing designer by profession, Yawo opened his fashion boutique in 1996.  In addition to this work, he sells fabric and sewing accessories such as pins, ribbons, and zippers. His wife is a saleswoman.  He is 39 and the father of three children.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing accessories.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 43 years old and has been engaged in rice farming for more than 21 years. She is married with three children aged 21, 16 and 4. Lani now owns and tills a plot of land with her husband. They primarily grow rice crops to sell to rice traders. Lani works hard to feed her children and send them to school. She also does her best to keep their farm productive.
Lani has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She wants to become a successful businesswoman some day.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Primero de Mayo, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente es amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, laboran en el comercio, cría de animales y agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

La Señora. María es muy joven tiene 21 años y vive en unión libre, fruto de esa unión ha concebido un hijo de 1 año. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su suegra con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Nuestra socia labora como empleada domestica, esta actividad la desempeña hace 5 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas las que son para la venta y consumo.
  
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por su suegra, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para la construcción de su casa.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Primero de Mayo."  She lives in Cumbe parish, where the climate is cold and the people are friendly and maintain their culture and traditions.  The residents of this area work in retail trade, animal husbandry and agriculture.  Much of the population has migrated in search of better job opportunities.  

Maria is very young; she is 21 years old and is in a common-law marriage which has produced a 1 year-old child.  Her husband works as a bricklayer.  Maria does not have her own home, and so she lives in her mother-in-law's house and shares the household expenses with her.

Maria works as a domestic.  She has been doing this work for 5 years, and she works Mondays through Fridays.  In her house, she also raises hens for sale and for household consumption.

This is the first loan that she has taken from her communal bank.  She was invited to join the bank by her mother-in-law.  She will invest this loan in construction materials for the construction of her house.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban is a 63-year-old married woman with 11 children, 8 sons and 3 daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

To earn an income to support their family for the past 20 years, Ban and her husband have run a coffee shop in front of their house. From their shop they sell coffee, cigarettes and sugarcane juice.

Ban would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity and range of coffee, cigarettes and beverages to sell from her shop. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of coffee, cigarettes and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 32 years old and married. She is thankful because she has been blessed with two children.

Leny has been raising piglets for two years. She is glad because she is able to sustain the needs of her family. She would like to maintain her business and improve her farm land, but she spends all her income on her children's needs and paying her electric bills. She is requesting a loan amount of P10,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy feed supplies for the pigs she raises. She hopes that through this loan she can increase her profit so that she could buy the farm supplies needed in her rice fields. Leny believes in the saying "Time is gold" because as days and time pass by, everything changes and you can change your lifestyle to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy feed supplies for the pigs she raises

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is a 52-year-old widowed woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. She earns a living running a general store, which she has done for eight years. 

Hong would like T. take out a loan T. buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and beverages T. stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her T. better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through this loan her business will generate a higher income and help her T. improve her family's living conditions and enable her T. save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy basic goods (snack foods and beverages) to stock her store.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco, de 24 años es un joven estudiante. Vive junto a sus padres en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. La mayor parte del año la pasa en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde estudia Ingeniería Química. Le falta muy poco para culminar sus estudios y desarrollarse como un profesional. Pero desde hace años comenzó a generar sus propios ingresos. Teje mantas, tapices y forros para sillones, los cuales comercializa a la ciudad de Cerro de Pasco, donde el frío es intenso, por ello tiene gran demanda. En todo este tiempo logró adquirir 5 telares, con los que realiza su trabajo. Él nunca descansa, ser activo es su principal virtud. Pues de lunes a viernes, estudia mientras que los fines de semana, continúa con su negocio. Paralelo a ello, también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes; hasta el momento tiene 100 ejemplares y para más adelante desea mejorar su granja con animales de raza, para aumentar sus ganancias en la asociación donde está inscrito.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “San pedro de Cajas” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr su objetivo. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marco de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 4 telares para continuar con sus hermosos tejidos.
texts.en: Marco, a young student, is 24 years old. He lives with his parents in their own home, located in San Pedro de Cajas. He spends the best part of the year in the city of Huancayo where he is studying chemical engineering. He is very close to completing his studies and becoming a professional. However, for years he has been generating his own income. He weaves rugs, carpets and chair covers which he sells in the city of Cerro de Pasco, where the cold is intense and the demand for his products high. In all this time he has managed to acquire 5 looms with which he practices his craft. He never rests, being active is his principal virtue, as from Monday to Friday he studies while at weekends he continues with his weaving business. In addition to all of this, he also breeds guinea pigs; up until now he has 100 exemplars and in the future he wants to improve the farm with pure bred stock so as to increase the profits he makes from the partneship he belongs to. He is a member of the communal bank "San Pedro de Cajas" and this is his second loan with MFP. He hopes that you will all support him so he can achieve his goal. In addition, he promises to be punctual with his repayments. Marco, on receiving your support, will invest the money requested in the purchase of 4 looms to continue making his beautiful fabrics.

loans.use: to buy 4 weaving looms.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is married and has three children. She is 35 years old and lives in Pulang Yuta. Gina is in agricultural business. She operated a specialized coconut farm to earn a living and she had in this business for 10 years. Every month, she earns Php 8, 345.00 doing this kind of business. Gina is request Php 30,000 to purchase fertilizers for her coconut farm and for the maintenance of her farm. She was able to help her neighbor because she paid them in cleaning her coconut farm. Gina striving herself to make her business successful for the future of her family and she plans to buy even a one hectare coconut farm with the help of Gata Daku.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

location.town: Pulang yuta, Kapatagan Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 28 años, una mujer trabajadora que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de su negocio.
Su negocio es la venta de especies como: ajo molido, ají, pimiento, etc.
Escogió esta actividad porque a ella le gusta el comercio, elabora esta actividad con su hermana.
Su trabajo lo efectúa con responsabilidad, su horario es de lunes a domingo, desde las 7:00am hasta las 12:00am.
Su dificultad es la delincuencia, ya que ha sido víctima de hurtos.
Es soltera y vive con sus padres.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir más en su negocio.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Flor, 28 years old, is a hard-working woman who has aspirations to grow her business. Her business is selling spices like ground garlic, aji (a kind of hot pepper, and black pepper.

She chose this business because she likes working in sales. She prepares the spices with her sister. The job is a big responsibility, and she works long hours Monday to Sunday from 7:00 am until midnight. Her biggest challenge is crime, and she has already been a victim of robberies. She is single and lives with her parents. She wants to use the loan to invest in her business. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: purchase spices and candy for her store

loans.name: Mercedes Nohemi

texts.es: Mercedes Nohemí, tiene 2 hijos de uno y cinco años. Ella para ganarse la vida y para que a sus hijos no le faltara nada empezó el negocio de destace de cerdo y venta de nacatamales, algunas veces tiene problemas con sus clientes ya que les ofrece crédito y algunos no le pagan. Por eso ahora solo vende a los que le pagan de contado. Ella trabaja todos los días de la semana, es por eso que solicita este crédito lo va emplear en comprar cerdos que se los ofrecen a buen precio. Sus sueños es seguir adelante en su negocio y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
Mercedes Nohemi  has two sons, ages one and five. In order to earn a living and so that her children will have all they need, she started a business butchering pigs and selling tamales. At time she has had problems with customers to whom she offered credit and who later never paid her. Consequently, she now sells only to those who pay her in cash.

She works every day of the week and requests this loan to purchase pigs that she can buy at a good price. Her dreams are to continue getting ahead in her business forward and to continue being healthy.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jorge Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, tiene una cantina en una pequeña escuelita de esa ciudad hace mas de 3 años. 
Jorge es muy responsable y profesional en su trabajo, busca siempre la excelencia en todo lo que hace, es por ello que se esfuerza al máximo por todo. El comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por darle lo mejor a su familia. 
En cuanto a su cantina nos dice que tiene muy buenas ventas ya que la escuela donde está ubicada tiene muchos alumnos, por ello solicita el crédito, ya que desea abastecer su negocio con galletitas, golosinas, gaseosas, y otro tipo de comestibles, los cuales tienen mucha salida. 
Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues el crédito le será de mucha ayuda en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge is 26 years old and lives in the city of Itá. He has been operating a snack bar at a small school in the city for more than three years. Jorge is very responsible and professional in his work. He always seeks excellence in everything he does. This is why he strives to do his best at all times. He says that all of his efforts are focused on providing the best for his family.

Jorge says that his snack bar generates very good sales since the school where his business is located has many students. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can restock his business with cookies, candy, sodas, and other types of snacks in order to have good results. Jorge is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to him. This loan will be of great help to this micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, sodas, and other types of snacks.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 39 years old and married with six children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling beer in Kator, South Sudan and she has been doing this for five years. Christine requested this loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC South Sudan, to purchase more beer to sell. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Ildefonso

texts.es: Ildefonso, de 38 años de edad, es un hombre muy fuerte y decidido, además de tener muchos deseos de superación, está casado con Yolanda que es cocinera en un internado, vive en compañía de su esposa y de sus cuatro hijos cómodamente instalados en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Ildefonso es el sembrío de plátanos y cacao, pero su principal producto es el siembra de yuca para la producción de almidón, que luego vende o entrega a pedido. Tiene 14 años realizando esta actividad, y con el tiempo ha logrado adquirir un terreno de 10 hectáreas de extensión en donde realiza su trabajo agrícola. Actualmente tiene la ayuda de 5 peones para la elaboración de almidón, a quienes paga por semana trabajada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el trabajo de campo pues comenta que esta acostumbrado y le gusta sembrar así como trabajar la tierra. A pesar  de eso, lo que no le gusta de su actividad es la  plaga de insectos que malogran la cosecha y ocasionan perdidas en la producción. Pero eso no lo desanima y tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e incursionar en la siembra de palma aceitera, pues  ha visto que tiene bastante demanda. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal  pues considera a sus miembros ser personas amables y responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una producción de yuca para elaborar almidón pues tiene  pedidos pendientes por entregar y su propia producción de yuca no le alcanzará.
texts.en:
Ildefonso, aged 38, is a very firm and focused man, who also has great desire to succeed.  He is married to Yolanda, who is a cook at a boarding-school.  He lives comfortably with his wife and four children in their own home.

The activity that Ildefonso does is growing plantains and cocoa, but his main crop is yucca for producing starch, which he later sells or delivers to meet orders.  He has been doing this work for 14 years, and over time he has been able to acquire 10 hectares of land where he undertakes his agricultural work.  He currently has 5 workers helping him to produce starch, whom he pays for each week worked.  

What he likes about his work is working in the fields, as he comments that he is used to it, and he enjoys farming and working the land.  In spite of this, what he doesn't like about his work are the insect infestations that damage the harvest and cause production losses.  But this doesn't discourage him, and he has plans to grow his business and move into growing palms for palm oil, as he has seen that there is significant demand for this.

This will be his third loan with the MFP institution.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support, as it allows him to feel secure in moving forward with his business.  He also comments that he feels good about his communal banks, as he considers the members to be friendly and responsible people.

With the amount requested of 2,000 new soles, he will invest in purchasing yucca for making starch, as he has orders in place to meet and his current yucca production will not be sufficient.

loans.use: to purchase yucca

loans.name: Yelizaveta

texts.ru:
Елизавета замужем. У нее двое детей. Елизавета живет в селе Вышково. Она на пенсии, но денег почти всегда не хватает, вследствие чего решила начать торговать фруктами. Елизавета выращивает фрукты в своем саду и еще дополнительно закупает экзотические фрукты, которые потом перепродает, тем самым получая дополнительный доход. 

Елизавете необходимы дополнительные средства для личных нужд. Она делает дома ремонт и хочет поменять двери, но собственных средств на это не хватит. Елизавета планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 5 000 гривен на приобретение и установку новых дверей в своем доме, благодаря чему в доме будет теплее и уютнее в эту холодную пору года. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Yelizaveta, who lives in Vyshkovo village, is married with two children. She is retired and is almost always in need. As a consequence, she started selling fruit which she grows in her orchard. She also buys exotic fruit that she resells at a profit, which provides additional income. 

Yelizaveta needs additional means for personal needs. She is renovating her house and would like to replace the old doors. Since she does not have enough money to do this, she is applying for a Kiva loan of 5 000 hryvnas. New doors will make the house warmer and cozier in this cold time of the year. 

Note: the original text is in Russian

loans.use: to replace the doors in her house

loans.name: 03.11.116.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên  has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Liên is 23 years old and she is married with 2 children, and she lives with her 2 dependents in Thiệu Hóa district. Liên is the group leader of the 03.11.116.Thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and has successfully repaid 2 loans previously. Liên has been involved in this business for 8 years, the main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Ms Phuong is 45 years old with 1 daughter who is at High school.  Being a farmer, she grows rice, vegetables and raises pigs for meat. This business has run many years. Participating in our credit program in 2010, she used loans to expand her farming activities and always in good repayment situation. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a sus hijos un mayor bienestar. Fanny es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijos a quienes su padre abandonó hace un tiempo sin hacer ninguna contribución económica. Es por esto que Fanny se vio en la obligación de generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Fanny, desde hace aproximadamente 3 años montó su tienda general para poder generar ingresos para su hogar. Debido al bajo capital con el que contaba, Fanny montó su tienda con muy poca variedad de productos, lo que hizo que en un comienzo fuese difícil posicionar su negocio. Gracias a la buena atención que ofrece Fanny ha podido posicionar su negocio y poco a poco ha ido aumentando la cantidad de productos que ofrece en su tienda. Con el ánimo de seguir aumentando la variedad de productos que ofrece, Fanny espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su tienda.
Fanny espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender mayores necesidades de sus clientes, además, podrá ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de progreso. Fanny sueña con que su negocio salga adelante y con que este le brinde la posibilidad de ofrecerle a sus hijos una estabilidad económica y poder tener una mejor capacidad económica en sus vidas.

loans.use: Compra de productos de la canasta familiar para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece en su tienda.

loans.name: Padma

texts.en:
Padma is a 49-year-old widow lady living with her children in a village in Odisha, India. She runs a grocery shop where she sells lentils, rice, edible oil, wheat flour, spices, salt, biscuits, etc. She has very good relations with her customers. She earns 5,000 INR from this shop, which is not enough for her family to survive. She has a plan to add more stock of what she sells to her shop plus a few more products like hair oil, shampoo, potatoes, onions, etc. 

Padma has requested a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase more stock of what she sells and the new products that are mentioned above. She says that doing so will attract more customers as she would be able to fulfill the maximum demands of her customers and will increase her client base. She has a dream of having her children well educated and saving some money for their future.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil, shampoo, potatoes, onions, lentils, wheat flour, etc. for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 32-year-old married man with 1 child.

He has had a motorbike transportation business for 4 years and will use the loan to purchase a new motorbike. He hopes this will help him to educate his children and provide for their basic needs well.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to fully pay for his children's school fees and provide for his family.

He is in his first loan cycle and has borrowed 105,500 KHS to be repaid in 18 months.

loans.use: to purchase new motorbike

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith works selling fried chicken, habmurguers and hot dogs at her own home she used the room where the living used to be to open it as a restaurant she is the mother of 2 daughters she is married and she needs a loan to buy an oven for her food business she hopes you can help her because she is a good cook and she lives her work

loans.use: to buy an oven for her business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: I do business in Kisumu Town. I have 3 children and am a single mother. I want the loan to expand my business and purchase clothes for the season. School is currently openning and many customers want to buy school uniforms for both primary and secondary schools.

loans.use: To purchase and stock my second hand clothing business.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro has a small plot of land where he produces rice. He has been living on this land for thirty years with his wife. He has three children ages 16, 13 and 11, all of whom are in school. He will use the loan to clean and prepare his lands in order to make them adequate for rice production. He is planning to make several improvements to his home because the floor and roof need much work.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water.
