They have four children, and one of their daughters is employed in a garment factory. 

Pal U. will use her loan to buy a used motorbike to pick up her fish and also  for other traveling needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to pick up her fish and for other trips.

loans.name: Achola

texts.en: J., a 46-year-old married mother of four school-going children, is currently in the business of selling bedsheets. J. has requested a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell, and hopes to construct a house for her family in the future with the extra profits arising from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 39 years old.  She is married with one child, who is 14 years old, and one dependent relative. She has been running a pub for the past year.  She works from 8am until 11pm every day.

Flora has requested her first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying new materials like tables, glasses, a fridge and more beer - like Primus - and so on. With this expansion, she hopes to earn more profits than before. This will enable her to buy her own house, pay school fees for her children, and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy new materials like tables, glasses, a fridge and more beer, and so on

loans.name: Brunilda Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Brunilda, tiene la edad de 58 años habita en el municipio Nindiri, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tienen nueve hijos todos independientes, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, doña Brunilda desde hace veinte años se dedica al cultivo de yuca, la mayor afectación son las plagas que invaden el cultivo ya que este careces de  fertilizantes,  ella con el  financiamiento quiere comprar materiales vegetativos, fertilizantes e insumos para lograr una producción de calidad y puedan pagar un buen precio .
texts.en: Brunilda is 58 years old and lives in the municipality of Nindiri with her husband who helps her with the farming tasks.  They have nine children, all of whom are independent.  Her plan for her family is to be able to improve their living conditions.  Brunilda has worked growing yucca for the past twenty years.  The greatest difficulty is the pests that invade her crops as they lack fertilizer.  With the loan, she wants to buy vegetative materials, fertilizers and supplies in order to have a good-quality production and sell the crops at a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Luz De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Doña María Isabel, es la presidenta de Banco Mujer Luz De Esperanza,  una señora muy emprendedora, de 48 años de edad, madre de 4 hijos, y actualmente vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores. Doña María no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para contribuir a los ingresos económicos de su familia.  Sin embargo eso no fue un impedimento  para desarrollar su negocio; Y hoy es una comerciante con mucha experiencia que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia ya que su esposo no puede trabajar debido a una enfermedad. 
Se enteró de los servicios de Fundación Mujer por medio de una integrante de otro banco,  este es su primer crédito, y sus actividades productivas son la avicultura y el comercio. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pollos y gallinas ponedoras así como alimentos, concentrados vitaminas y otros insumos para la cría de estos animales.  
La clienta tiene su negocio hace más de 15 años, y recuerda que con un poco de dinero que se gano con la venta de unas comidas compró sus primeros pollos; el principal obstáculo que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de dinero para invertir en su  microempresa, que podrá ir superando con los financiamientos ya que es una herramienta para hacer crecer su negocio.  Ella tiene sus metas y objetivos bien definidos, entre ellos están, mejorar la condición económica de su familia, brindarles estudios universitarios a sus hijos menores y también una mejor atención medica para su esposo.  Estas son solo algunas de las metas que se ha propuesto lograr con mucho trabajo y dedicación. 
El crédito va hacer de gran ayuda para María Isabel y sus 6 compañeras del banco, que se dedican a actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel, is president of Light of Hope Women's Bank.  She is a very enterprising lady, a 48-year-old mother of 4 children and she currently lives with her husband and 2 young children.  María had no opportunity to study since as a very young woman she had to work to contribute to the family income. But this was not an impediment to developing her business and today she is a very experienced businesswoman who has managed to raise her family because her husband can't work due to illness. 

Maria Isabel heard of the Women's Foundation services by a member of another bank.  This is her first loan, and her activities are poultry production and business. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and laying hens and feed, concentrates, vitamins and other supplies for rearing animals. 

Maria Isabel has had a business for over 15 years.  She remembers that with a bit of money earned by selling some food, she bought her first chickens.  The main obstacle that she has faced is the lack of money to invest in microenterprise, financing that would be used as a tool to grow her business. 

She has well-defined goals and objectives, among them are to enhance the status of her family, provide a college education for their minor children and better medical care for her husband. These are just some of the goals she has set out to achieve with hard work and dedication. 

This loan will be a great help to Maria Isabel and her 6 companions of the bank.  They work in agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs, cattle and animal feed.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Born in 1983, Mai lives in Xom Trong village, Uy No commune with her husband and a son. Her husband is a driver. Mai grows rice and vegetables and sells lottery tickets as well. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.

Mai has secured loans from SEDA since 2007 and always has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. 

In the photograph Janet has displayed toffees, biscuits, matches, sugar and other items that she sells at Elmina, a fishing community on the Cape Coast. She wants to increase the quantity of goods sold and so a loan will serve as increased capital to buy more of the above mentioned items to sell. 

She responsibly supports her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. Her new profit will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: to buy toffees, biscuits, matches, sugar and other items that she sells.

loans.name: Mujeres Capaces Ii Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Mujeres Capaces II es de la ciudad de Encarnación, actualmente cuenta con 12 miembros. Todas ellas trabajan en un marco de cooperación, respeto y solidaridad. Se unieron con un fin común, que es la obtención de mayores ingresos para que cada una pueda de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Manifiestan que están muy contentas dentro de su comité, ademas de eso les gustaría poder seguir con el apoyo de la Fundación, ya que les ha sido de mucha ayuda.
La Sra. Miguela tiene una despensa en su casa, por medio de esto ella puede solventar todos los gastos de su casa. Manifiesta que este negocio la ha ayudado a progresar y a obtener mayores ingresos. Le gustaría algún día poder aumentar su pequeño local para tener mas estantes donde exhibir sus productos.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de fideos, arroz, azúcar, carnes, lácteos y demás para abastecerse de mercaderías.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Capaces II' committee is located in the city of Encarnación.  It currently has 12 members.  All of these women work within a framework of cooperation, respect and solidarity.  They came together with a common goal which was to make more income so that they could help their families.

The group say that they are very happy in their committee.  They would like to be able to continue receiving the support of Fundación Paraguaya since it has been very helpful to them.

Miguela has a grocery store in her home and, through her store, she is able to cover all her household expenses.  She says that this business has helped her to make progress and make more income.  Some day she would like to be able to expand her small business  with more shelves on which to display her products.

Miguela is requesting this loan to buy noodles, rice, sugar, meat, dairy products, etc. to stock her business with merchandise.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, groceries, meat and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Hermelenda

texts.en:
Hermelenda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Hermelenda has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy more of the items her store sells.

Hermelenda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Hermelenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, & beverages

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con un hijo y una sobrina, es viuda, agricultora, siembra maíz, este negocio surgió gracias a su esposo quien lo desempeñaba y le enseño el oficio, lo atiende junto a mozos que paga, no tienen horario fijo para trabajar.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono, otros fertilizantes  y pagar mano de obra, este prestamo le ayudara a trabajar los cultivos y sacar buena cosecha para mejorar sus ingresos.
su objetivo es sacar buenos cultivos para mejorar junto a us familia cubriendo las necesidades y teniendo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa lives with her son and a niece. She is a widow and works as a farmer harvesting corn. This business started thanks to her husband, who carried out the labor and taught her the trade. She tends to the crops along with young workers whom she pays, and they don't have a fixed work schedule. She is requesting the loan to purchase manure and other fertilizers as well as to pay for labor. This loan will help her better tend to her crops so she has a good harvest and improve her income. Her goal is to have good crops so she can cover necessities and provide herself and her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure, other fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 34-year-old married woman with three sons. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Anh earns an income to support her family by running a noodle stall in front of her house. She has been running her noodle business for the past four years.

Anh would like to receive a L. to repair her food stall and buy more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and set aside some savings for the education of her children.

loans.use: to repair her food stall and buy more food to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita sells Agro chemicals at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. The shop has been in existence for seven years. She supports her partner in providing the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy additional chemicals and other types of chemicals to be able to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the fresh earnings from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy additional Agro chemicals

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married, and all of her children are attending school. Her husband builds houses. Agnes has a food store; she sells beans, sorghum, maize, etc. She has been running this business for four years. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She needs a loan to buy more bananas, beans and cassava. She will use the profits to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy food that she will sell in her store.

loans.name: José Edilberto

texts.es:
Don José tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos.

El señor José desde muy pequeño inicio a trabajar en el campo, su papá fue quien le enseño el trabajo de la agricultura. Él siembra maíz y maicillo, se levanta a la 4:30 de la mañana a ordeñar una vaca, luego desayuna para irse al trabajo, debe caminar 30 minutos a pie hasta llegar al lugar donde tiene sus cultivos y de esta manera aprovecha trabajar 8 horas diarias.

Para poder cultivar don José tiene que adquirir insumos como fertilizantes, para que su cosecha se ha buena, estos los compra  en un pueblo del oriente del país, para ello debe caminar unos 30 minutos a pie desde su casa hasta el lugar donde los compra, a veces el aborda una mototaxi para llegar mas rápido y le toma unos 10 minutos.

El señor José utilizara el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono y veneno para su cultivo, ya que tiene sembrado una manzana y media de maicillo y esta necesita los nutrientes para producir buenos frutos. Él desea obtener una mejor producción y que sea abundante, ya que de esta manera obtendrá mejores ganancias. De esta manera don José podrá tener una seguridad económica y le brindara un mejor futuro a su familia, enviando a sus hijos a estudiar.

El sueño de don José es que sus hijos se gradúen en la Universidad y que no tengan que trabajar como él de fuerte. Desea que ellos tengan una mejor vida y un mejor futuro para sus familias.
texts.en:
Don José is 46 years old and lives with his life companion and three children.

Señor José started working in the fields when he was very young, and was taught the business of agriculture by his father.  He grows corn and millet, rising at 4:30 in the morning to milk a cow.  After breakfast, he must walk 30 minutes to get to where he has his crops, and once there he works an 8 hour day.

To be able to grow his crops, Don José has to purchase supplies such as fertilizers in order to have a good harvest.  He buys these supplies in a village in the east of the country, which is a 30 minute walk from his home.  Sometimes he will take a mototaxi to get their quicker, which takes about 10 minutes.

Señor José will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure and poison for his crops, as he is planting a block and a half of millet, and needs these nutrients to products good crops.  He wants to improve his production and have it be abundant, as in this way he will get better earnings.  In this way Don José will be able to have financial security and provide a better future for his family, and will be able to send his children to school.

Don José's dream is for his children to graduate from university, and for them not to need to work as hard as he does.  He wants them to have a better life and future for their own families.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for growing millet.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 40 years old and married. His wife is Viola. They support a family of six people. He runs an agro-vet shop  which he has been operating for a period of three years.

Edwin has applied for a loan of Kshs.20,000 which he will use to purchase additional drugs and feeds for his agro-vet business.He earns an income of Kshs.15000 per month. The anticipated profit will be used to expand the business.

This is Edwin's first loan from KADET LTD.He hopes to stabilize his business, improve the living standard of the family and also improve the eduction level of his children .

loans.use: to purchase drugs and feeds for his agro-vet shop

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
William, vive con su esposa e hijos, es casado administrador y propietario de una tienda de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, dicho negocio surgió gracias al apoyo de su familia, lo instalo en su casa por lo tanto no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos para su negocio: pan, huevos, azucar, pastas, galletas, boquitas, gaseosas, ya que sus clientes a diario demandan estos productos, esta compra le ayudara a crecer y mejorar su negocio.
El sueño de William, es crecer en el negocio y en ingresos para ayudar en los gastos a su familia y darles a sus hijos la educación que merecen.
texts.en:
William is married, and lives with his wife and children. He owns and operates a store that has basic staples, such as rice, beans,and corn. This store came about thanks to the support of his family. He set it up in his home, and therefore he doesn't have fixed hours for serving customers.

He is applying for a loan to buy products for his business, such as bread, eggs, sugar, pasta, cookies, snacks, and soft drinks, as his customers ask for these products on a daily basis. This purchase will help him expand and improve his business.

William's dream is to see his business grow, and his income increase, in order to help with his family's expenses, and give his children the education they deserve.

loans.use: To buy bread, eggs, sugar, pasta, cookies, snacks, and soft drinks for his business.

loans.name: Geyzzel Eleana

texts.es:
Geyzzel tiene 21 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Buena Vista. Ella es madre soltera con un hijo de 5 meses de edad. Ella vive con su madre, hermana y hermano. Geyzzel está en el proceso de terminar  sus estudios. 

Hace dos años, Geyzzel se puso un negocio de la venta de ropa. Su madre le ayudó empezar el negocio con un poco de semilla capital y mano de obra. Geyzzel vende ropa nueva y usada de damas, caballeros y niños. Hace sus ventas de forma ambulante y también de su casa. 

Geyzzel se puso el negocio debido a la gran cantidad de gente que manejan negocios semejantes y que han tenido éxito en ello. Solicitó su primer préstamo de L10,000 para la compra de ropa para ampliar su inventario y surtir más el negocio.
texts.en:
Geyzzel is 21 years old, and she lives in the village of Buena Vista.  She is a single mother, and she has a five month old son.  She lives with her mother, her sister, and her brother.  Geyzzel is in the process of finishing her studies.

Two years ago Geyzzel established a business selling clothes.  Her mother helped her start the business with a little seed money and some labor.  Geyzzel sells new and used clothes for women, men, and children.  She makes her sales in an itinerant manner, and she also sells at her house.  Geyzzel established her business because of the great many people who manage similar businesses and have had success with them.

She requested her first loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy clothes to increase her inventory and to stock her business more.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothes.

loans.name: Amgalanbayar

texts.en:
Amgalanbayar is 20 years old and lives with his mother, wife and son in ger (Mongolian tent) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. 

His mother is unemployed and his wife babysits their newborn child.  He is a certified welder who started welding in 2008 as employee of small company.  In September of 2011 he decided to open his own business.  He has already rented a place to run his business, however due to a shortage of equipment, he couldn't open for business. 

His rented workshop is right next to the main road and it is in an industrial district, therefore should be a profitable location. 

He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy a welding machine to run his business.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine to run his business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is widowed with one child. She is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Monica is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizer for rice growing. Monica has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Monica hopes to save money in case of emergency.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice growing.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor   Juan Antonio es un hombre trabajador que le gusta  salir adelante y superar todas las pruebas que le pone la vida, el trabaja en los taxis  y tiene su tienda de ropa donde también vende calzado y un poco de dulces.
Este felizmente casado con la señora Carmen con quien tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, una de las cosas por la que decidió poner su propio negocio es para ofrecerle una mejor vida a su pequeño hijo.
El pidió el préstamo para comprar mas ropa para caballero y para dama ya que su localidad se vende muy bien vende su ropa en pagos y ha contado.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Antonio is a hardworking man who likes to get ahead and overcome all the challenges that life presents him with. He works in the taxi sector and has his own clothes store where he also sells footwear and a few sweets.

He is happily married to Señora Carmen with whom he has a 2 year old child. One of the things that made him decide to start his own business is to offer his child a better life. 

He asked for the loan to buy more ladies' and men's clothing as clothes sell very well in his area both on credit and for cash. He thanks the Fundacion for the support they have given him to get ahead and offer his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Edith has a food shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Edith has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Chroeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Chroeng, age 51, is the loving mother of four children. Most of her children have quit studying and started working in different kinds of careers. She permanently lives in Reussey Keo commune and her work is dedicated to rice husbandry. She has been involved in the business since 1990, while her husband shares responsibilities by providing a construction service from place to place to generate income.

Mrs. Chroeng would like to take out her third loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle to satisfy the whole family. With any remaining funds, she will pay for the expenses of her farm for the new season. For her business goal, she plans to raise poultry in her yard and generate additional income.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle to satisfy the whole family.

loans.name: Jubilee Tukore Group

texts.en:
Jubilee Tukore, a recurrent group for loans is located on the outskirts of Ibanda town. 

Saidat, a widow, used her previous loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell. She made enough profits and has repaid her entire loan well. She also managed to pay tuition for four of her children.

She has now applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to buy more stock of clothes; this being a festive season, she believes she will make more sales since many people will be buying new clothes.

Her major challenge is high transport costs from the city to where she sells them and taxes which eat into her profits, coupled with the fact that she has to meet her family demands single handedly.

Despite these challenges Saidat is very hard-working and committed, striving to provide a better life and education for her children.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia Julia   se dedica al negocio de venta de comida,la socia tiene un restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Julia, earns a living selling food.  She has a restaurant and works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. making a variety of dishes, including baked chicken, soup, and sauteed meat.  She has been in this business for eight years already and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.

Julia's requesting the loan to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Tilatama

texts.en:
Tilatama is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her mother-in-law and her son. She has a small grocery shop in her house where she sells wheat flour, lentils, rice, edible oil, spices, salt, batteries and biscuits. She earns 2,000 INR per month from her shop, which is not enough for a family of three. She is the only one to support her family. 

She has requested a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase more stock of rice, lentils, oil, spices, etc. and add new product lines to her shop like cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo sachets, and detergents to meet her customers’ demands and make them highly satisfied. She hopes to build a separate shop outside her house and take good care of her son.

loans.use: to purchase rice, lentils, oil, spices, cosmetics, hair oil, shampoo sachets, and detergents.

loans.name: Logo

texts.en:
Logo is a 40 year old mother with 3 children and had a small business of selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. Logo requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots to assist her run the business. 

She hopes to expand her business by using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots

loans.name: Madeley

texts.es: Laboriosa y perseverante son características que describen a Madeley, una mujer de 43 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa usada de manera ambulante desde hace cuatro años, solicita por tercer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de perfumes, cremas camisas, faldas y pantalones. Una de sus metas es incursionar en un nuevo negocio de venta de pollo, considera que es una buena oportunidad de negocio porque su casa está ubicada en un punto céntrico.

loans.use: para la compra de perfumes, cremas camisas, faldas y pantalones

loans.name: Jamela

texts.en:
Jamela is 32 years old with her 7 children living in district 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is married and she took out a loan for her son to increase his business. She hopes to receive more loans through AFSG to continue her son's business.

loans.use: To buy fuel and gas for her son.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa lives with her husband and has five children. Her children are all grown up but two still live with her. She is also caring for a close family friend who has a brain tumor, but cannot afford medical care. With her loan she will invest in her rice production. As complimentary crops she farms cacao, mangoes and corn. She hopes that, with the loan, she will be able to invest in her land, making the soil more productive. She also wants to finish a section of her home which is still under construction.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en: Tojiniso is married and has 2 children. She worked at a clothing factory for over 8 years but after the collapse of USSR, the salary of seamstress was not enough to support a family. In 1994 Tojiniso borrowed $100 from relatives and started her business. From the beginning she knew the success in her business depended on variety of goods she sold. Often, she took individual orders to meet the special request of her customers. Today Tojiniso has gained a reputation as a committed and responsible market vendor among her clients. She brings her goods from Istaravshan,Tadjikistan. Tojiniso would like to borrow $1200 to purchase modern clothes for the summer season. In future she wishes to open a shop in the center of Khujand.

loans.use: Purchase modern clothes

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira worked at the hospital as a nurse for10 years, but today life conditions compel her to have a business for supporting her family. Her husband drives a microbus. They have two children, a boy and a girl, who are students.

Munira rented one little shop in the Kistakuz big market, in Khujand. She buys different kinds of dishes, makes presents from the dishes, and sells them. She also sells pillows and towels. She included these items to attract more clients. She orders her supplies from China. Her daughter helps her to sell the items in the shop after her lessons.

Munira requests 200USD to expand her assortment of items to sell. She wants to buy modern dishes from China.

In the photo, you can see her daughter Mutribahon.

loans.use: Business development.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana (her husband is pictured) is 26 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Tarana's husband has been a taxi driver for 2 years and the couple is requesting a loan of $725 to buy spare parts for the taxi.

loans.use: To buy spare machine parts

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Sra. Ruth belongs to the Amigos Marcarinos ("Marcara-Area Friends") community bank. Her shop is located in her house in Marcara, northern Peru. She sells groceries and soft drinks, at retail, a business that she's developed over the last three years.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$99), to be repaid in 4 installments, she purchased bulk supplies of soft drinks (of various brands) to supply and grow her business.

Sra. Ruth, 39, lives her son and mother. She's thriving at business, like anyone who aspires to get ahead. Her mother and 12-year old son help her with the business, as well as everything else in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Ella es la señora Ruth pertener al Banco Comunal Amigos Marcarinos, su local se encuentra en su domicilio, ubicado en el Distrito de Marcara, Provincia de Carhuaz, Departamento de Ancash, ella vende un poco de abarrotes y gaseosas al por menor, actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace tres años,

Con el reciente préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 ($ 99), que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, compro 10 cajas de gaseosas medianas, 10 paquetes de gaseosas de 3 litros (varias marcas), ello permitirá surtir e incrementar su negocio.

La señora tiene 39 años, vive con su único hijo y con su madre, es una prospera negociante como cualquier persona que aspira seguir superándose. En el negocio, recibe el apoyo de su hijo, que ya tiene 12 años y su madre, quienes la apoyan en todo.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Rwentobo Women's Group

texts.en:
Constance is the chairperson of the Rwentobo Women’s Group in Ntungamo. Ntungamo is surrounded by lush green rolling hills in western Uganda, not far from the Impenetrable Forest made famous in the movie Gorillas in the Mist and the African Pygmies. The residents here are primarily rural subsistence farmers who coffee and matooke and raise the famous Ankole cattle, with their 3ft curved horns rising gracefully upwards.

Most of the members in the group live on farms and the tranquility and beauty of these mud and twig villages is enough to make you want to move there. Although poor financially, these villagers are not lacking in food and their shelter is quite adequate for the climate. There are no jobs, so people either establish a business, or just live off the land. Poverty is relative and these villagers are gentle and rich in spirit. They have time for family and community, which is important because there are a very large number of orphans due to AIDS throughout Uganda and orphanages abound.

Constance has operated a hair salon for 3 years and been a part of her lending group for 5 years. She is 30 years old, single and has one child. With her portion of the group loan (about $375) she will buy shampoos, chemicals and other items for her business.

loans.use: Constance will use her part of the group loan to buy more shampoos and chemicals for her hair salon.

loans.name: Kagugube B Group

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old, divorced and has three children. The children are all at school. She wants to use her extra business profits to open up another salon. Harriet has a stone quarrying business. Adronica grows flowers to sell while Sarah is a poultry farmer.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to buy more hairdryers

loans.name: Natiq

texts.en: A. Natiq is a 32-year-old man who sells milk and yoghurt to the local bazaar traders. He is married and has three children. He has six years of experience in this field.  He would like to expand his business buying four calves for an estimated cost of $300 USD each. He is going to start selling calves for meat production.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Olga Lidia

texts.es:
Olga R. is a single mother and has a 4 year old son. Faced with the need to help her family and pay for her young son's expenses along with her own, she started selling jewelry as of 3 years ago. She buys gold and silver jewelry from the city of Monterrey in order to buy it at a less expensive price. Today, she has much more of an inventory which for the most part is made out of gold.

She needs $1125 USD which she will repay in 6 months. This loan will help her buy display cases to generate more sales and income. With your contribution, Olga will be able to give a better life to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga R. es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 4 años ante la necesidad de ayudar a su familia y solventar los gastos de su pequeño hijo así como personales, hace 3 años ella inicio comprando joyería de oro y plata en la ciudad de Monterrey para conseguirla mas barata, actualmente ya cuenta con mas inventario la mayor parte de oro.

Requiere US $ 1125 que pagara en 6 meses, este crédito la va a apoyar para comprar exhibidores y poder generar más ventas e ingresos. Con tus contribuciones Olga le podrá dar una mejor vida a su pequeño.

loans.use: Purchase display cases

loans.name: Mercedes' Group

texts.en:
Mercedes coordinates the activities of a group of five women, all of whom are operating businesses in the Los R. community of San Cristobal. Mercedes sells tablecloths, curtains, bed sheets and the like to the women of the community. The entrepreneur has five sons who range from thirteen to twenty years old. Mercedes explains that this activity is the principal source of income of the family. Her husband is currently unemployed. With her loan, the businesswoman will buy more goods to offer to her customers in order to increase her revenue and improve her family’s living conditions.

The members of Mercedes’ group are: Adargiza R. G., to sell clothing in bulk; Lucrecia Carmona M., to invest in the buy of clothing for her business; Juana Yabelin S., to add new styles of shoes to her stock; Olga J., to buy clothing for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of curtains, bed sheets and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is divorced and has one child. She has a business selling clothing items in the central market of Ordzhonikidze. She offers a big assortment of inventory and has a flexible discount system for her loyal customers. Marina’s business is going well as demand has been very stable over the last 2 years. Currently, she has about $4000 of working capital and makes about $500 in net profit each month.

Marina is an entrepreneur of high integrity. She is very hard working and energetic. Even when her competitors have similar product or lower prices, clients naturally gravitate to her as she can skillfully make them feel valued, respected and heard. Marina is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase seasonal clothing which will help her to continue stabilizing her business and income so she can support herself and her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida baji is the wife of M. S. and lives in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. ( Baji is an Urdu term meaning 'elder sister'.) She is the mother of seven children; five sons and two daughters. Her eldest son completed education through what would equate to the tenth grade. The next oldest son left school earlier and drives a donkey cart. Her youngest son and daughter are in kindergarten.

Her husband runs an electric shop. Shahida baji successfully repaid her first loan from a microfinance institute of Pakistan and is applying for another loan for her husband’s electric shop.

She has four other members of her loan group. Kalsoom baji wants a loan for her tea shop; Kosar baji would like a loan for her beauty parlor; Mumtaz baji wants a loan for her decorative embroidery business and Hajra baji wants loan to buy a donkey cart.

The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To upgrade an electric shop

loans.name: Asteria

texts.es:
Asteria is 39 years old and a mother of 5 school age children, the oldest of who helps her in her business. Asteria makes and sells delicious ice cones (ice and fruit syrup) and refreshments, which are consumed often in the hot climate of the area. Mrs. Asteria’s husband is a teacher at a high school and together they move their home forward and provide for the needs of their children in the hopes of having a happy life. The dream of this mother is to have a small ice cream store. She is coming to you asking for a loan to be able to build a stand from which she can sell her refreshments and ice cones and make her customers and herself more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Asteria es una madre de 39 años y 5 hijos, en edad escolar, el mayor de ellos le ayuda en su negocio. Asteria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de deliciosas raspadillas (hielo y jarabe de fruta) y refresco, muy consumidos por el clima cálido de la zona.El esposo de doña Asteria es profesor en un gimnasio y juntos sacan adelante a su hogar y proveen las necesidades de sus hijos, en espera de que vivan felices. El sueño de esta madre es tener una pequeña heladería. Ella recurre a ustedes en solicitud de un préstamo para construir un kiosko, para la venta de sus refrescos y raspadillas, y así brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y a ella misma.

loans.use: Build a stand for the sale of refreshments and ice cones.

loans.name: Mage M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Mage G.. She is married and has five children aged between 10 and 18. In 2005, Mage established her crops-selling business. She opens her business six days a week between nine and twelve hours a day. She is assisted by her children. Mage requires a loan in order to purchase more crops in bulk. In the future, Mage plans to expand and establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Batuli's Tusongembele Group

texts.en:
Batuli is married with three children aged 20,18 and six years old. She own a small shop and she is a tomatoes and onion seller. Every day, she works from 5am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Batuli is looking for a loan to buy more tomatoes, onion and other commodities for expansion of her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members Azmina, Siti, Zainab, Sunna, Raya and Ashura.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, onion and other commodities.

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
Martha inició el negocio por la falta de trabajo y por que nadie le ayudaba con los gastos de sus hijos y de la casa, ya que se encuentra separada de su marido, por lo cual decidio invertir algo de dinero en una tienda de abarrotes que poco a poco ha hecho progresar y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar vitrinas y estantes para exhibir su mercancia. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Martha started her business because she was out of work and because nobody was helping her with the expenses from her children and household as she is now separated from her husband. For this reason, she decided to invest some money in a grocery shop that, little by little, has progressed and has allowed her to get her family ahead.

She needs a loan of $500 that she will repay in 6 months to buy glass cases and shelves to show her merchandise. With your help she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Glass Cases and Shelves

loans.name: Olga Marleni

texts.es:
Olga es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hijos de 10 años que está en el colegio.
Olga tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos , vende solo los productos de belleza de Esika. Empezó con este negocio desde hace 2 meses, ella antes vendía ropa (lencería) .
Olga necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos para su stock.
Olga desde que recibe los préstamos ha mejorado , se siente tranquila.  
Olga sueña con tener un bazar, para poder vender diversos artículos.
texts.en:
Olga is a partner in the Sea of Silver Community Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her partner. Olga has one son who is 10 years old and attends primary school. Olga sells Esika brand cosmetics. She used to sell clothing (lingerie) and started this cosmetics business two months ago. She needs a loan of 400 soles, which she'll use to buy cosmetics for her stock. Since she's been receiving loans Olga's situation has improved, and she feels peaceful. She dreams of having a bazar, so that she can sell a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Olga needs a loan of 400 soles, which she'll invest in cosmetics for her stock.

loans.name: Heyvagul

texts.en:
Heyvagul Q., 41, began raising cattle in southern Azerbaijan in 1994 when her husband lost his job, leaving her family without any means of subsistence. Taking the situation in hand, she borrowed money from friends to purchase two calves, and in less than six months was earning a stable income. Now Heyvagul is doing well and her four children are always nourished since she also keeps a cow for milk and yogurt production.

Heyvagul is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase four calves. Let’s do our best to help this brave woman.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 34 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida en la calle desde hace 3 años y su buena sazón en la preparación de alimentos hace que las personas regresen a consumir sus deliciosos platos, los cuales ofrece  a precios módicos. Además, Flor trata de brindar a sus clientes la mejor atención posible para asegurar su fidelidad e incrementar sus comensales, y por ende sus ingresos. Lo pesado de su labor es tener que levantarse muy de mañana y preparar todo lo necesario para luego salir a vender. Es una clienta nueva en MFP, y desea seguir trabajando con este grupo de socias a las cuales esta integrándose. Flor invertirá en la compra de vitrinas, que faciliten su trabajo y capten la atención de las personas para poder consumir sus platillos.
texts.en:
Flor is 34 years old, is a single mother, and lives with her three children. She has sold food in the street for 3 years, and her good seasoning in the preparation of the food makes people return to eat her delicious plates, which she offers at modest prices. Also, Flor tries to give her clients the best attention possible to assure their loyalty and increase her customers. In this way, she will increase her income. The difficult thing is having to wake up very early in the morning and prepare everything that she needs to sell her food. She is a new client of MFP and wants to continue working with this group, which she is becoming integrated into. Flor will invest by buying a showcase, which will make her work easier and will capture people’s attention so that they will eat her food.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a showcase for her business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 49 años, vive con su pareja con la que tiene 4 hijos, felizmente en todos estos años pudieron adquirir una casa propia que es donde viven. Él es un hombre muy activo, tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes y golosinas en las afueras de su casa desde hace 4 años, el coloca sobre unas mesas sus producto y otros los cuelga donde pueda atraer miradas del público, empezó así porque notó la necesidad de este tipo de negocio en su zona. Además de atender durante todo el día, Miguel sale por las noches a vender golosinas y cigarros de forma ambulante. Lo que le gusta de este trabajo es que le produce buenos ingresos, es por eso que trabaja duro, ya que él dice que “las ganancias no caen del cielo y hay que esforzarse por ellas”, es por eso que no contento con trabajar todo el día, también utiliza algunas horas de la noche para seguir vendiendo sus productos. Debido a su deseo de seguir progresando, supo de los créditos de MFP, por lo que ahora está participando de su primer préstamo junto a las personas de su banco comunal, la cantidad que Miguel solicita es para construir un kiosco donde pueda colocar mejor sus productos y protegerlos del sol y de la lluvia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 49 years old and lives with his partner, which whom he has four children. Happily, over all these years, they were able to acquire their own home that they now live in. He is a very active man who, for the past four years, has had a business selling groceries and sweets/snacks just outside his house. He displays some of his merchandise on tables, while hanging other items up in order to attract the public’s attention. He started out in this endeavor after noticing that this type of business was needed in his area. In addition to tending to his store all day, Miguel goes out at night to sell snacks and cigars on the streets. What he enjoys about his work is that it generates a good income. This is why he works hard since, as he says, “money doesn’t fall from the sky and one must make an effort to earn it”. This is why he isn’t content to just work during the day, but also spends some hours in the evenings to continue selling his products. As a result of his desire to continue to advance, he knew about the MFP loans and is now participating in his first loan along with other members of his cooperative bank. The amount Miguel is requesting is to build a kiosk where he may better display his products, and to protect them from the sun and rain.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk for his business.

loans.name: Abdulakim

texts.ru: Абдулаким мужчина в возрасте63 лет отец троих взрослых сыновей,которые на заработках в России.Абдулаким вместе с женой занимаются бизнесом животноводства.Все три сына имеют свои отдельные семьи и поэтому не помогают своим родителям.Поэтому Абдулаким не смотря на свои годы очень энергичный и продвижной мужчина который хорошо разбирается в этом бизнесе.Абдулаким хочет купить пару коров чтоб его жена занималась в дальнейшем продажей домашнего молока, благодаря чему они смогут улучшить свою жизнь.
texts.en:
Abdulakim is a 63 year old man. He is the father of three adult sons who are away working in Russia. Abdulakim together with his wife has a livestock business. The three sons have their own families and therefore do not help their parents. That is why Abdulakim despite his age is a very energetic and motivated man who understands this business well. Abdulakim would like to purchase a pair of cows so that his wife can sell milk in the future, thanks to this they will be able to improve their lives.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two cows

loans.name: Slmb Secondary School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the S.L.M.B Secondary School, Magburaka. S.L.M.B. was established in 1961 by Alhaji Sorie Kanu to provide education for the people of Magburaka and for the propagation of Islam. Today, it has a total of 616 pupils with a staff of eighteen teachers and administrators. 

S.L.M.B Secondary School had never got a loan from SMT before.  They heard of SMT from colleagues in other schools who have benefited greatly from SMT’s services. They decided to form a group and send in an application to SMT requesting a loan after hearing these other success stories. With the loan, some of the staff members will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (although this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs.  And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system.

Fifty-seven year old David P. G. (second from Left) is the principal of the school.  He was born in Matotoka, eight miles from Magburaka town. He is married to two wives and has fifteen children – between the ages of two and twenty-six. He has been a principal for the past twenty-one years. With this loan, David will buy building materials. Mr. David will be very pleased to receive this loan as it will enable him to speedily complete his house building project.

loans.use: Buy house building materials.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia J. has a sow. She started her business after she married. She is 36 years old and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. Together, they manage their business to support their family's needs. Aside from pigs, they also grow vegetables in their backyard. They water them every day and use the proceeds from their harvest to pay for their other needs.

Cynthia is asking a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets and feed to grow her piggery. She has regular buyers of her pigs. The loan will truly help her grow her business and earn more income to pay for schools, electricity, and food for her family.

CEVI is reaching out to help more pig growers sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides all their clients with credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage services to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed

loans.name: María Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora María Emperatriz G. O. tiene 46 años es tesorera de su banco comunal, vive en Chongoyape, distrito de Paijan,  provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no continúo estudiando debido a que se caso y se dedico a su hogar. Tiene 02 hijos y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
María tiene un mototaxi, cuando inicio se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza negocio que realizó durante 15 años, con las ganancias obtenidas pudo comprar un mototaxi hace 2 años, al principio lo alquilaba, pero ahora lo maneja su hijo; este negocio le es muy rentable y lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Manos Unidas”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza para su stock.  
Con el crédito de 600 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de repuestos para la reparación de su mototaxi.
María tiene el sueño de tener una Librería en su domicilio.
Ella pertenece al club de Madres (asociación de mujeres) de su sector.
texts.en:
María Emperatriz G. O. is 46 years old and is the treasurer of her communal bank. She lives in Chongoyape, in the district of Paijan, Ascope province, in La Libertad, Perú. She completed her secondary education but did not continue studying as she got married and took care of her home. She has 2 children, although neither one still depends financially on her. Maria has a motocycle taxi. She started off selling beauty products, which she did for 15 years. With the earnings from that, 2 years ago she was able to buy a motorcycle taxi. In the beginning she rented it out but now her son drives it. The business is very profitable and she runs it from her home. With her first loan for 300 soles which she received from the "Manos Unidos" communal bank, she invested in the purchase of beauty products for her inventory. With a loan for 600 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy replacement parts to repair her motorcycle taxi. Maria has a dream of setting up a bookstore in her house. She belongs to the Club de Madres (a women´s association) in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is 30 years old, single, and committed to God and her business. For the past year she has been a trader, trading in jeans, blouses, skirts, women's underwear, and bags. She has lots of experience in marketing, but does not have adequate funds for her business. She sells through hawking in the community as well as in other surrounding villages during their market days.

Demand for Linda's products is on the higher side, but she is not able to purchase high-quality products. She believes this loan will help her to access more resources in order to purchase higher-quality items in larger quantities so that she can scale up her sales. She particularly wants to use the loan to purchase denim clothing, ladies' wear, and slippers to increase her inventory.

Linda belongs to a village bank called ‘Nkwagyedom,’ which translates as "savior of the multitude or many."

loans.use: To purchase denim clothes, ladies' wear, and slippers for sale.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana has been a bites (bread-like rolls) seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for three years. She belongs to Dodoma Road C group loan (Group code 2030). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $100. Every day she works at her business for six hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Sebastiana is 35 years old, married, and has five children: ages 16, 13, 10, 4 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, sugar, cooking oli and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepción

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo M. actualmente tiene 20 años de dedicarse a su negocio de venta de productos ferreteros en la ciudad de Chinandega donde es visitado por muchos clientes en su establecimiento que ha logrado levantar.

Es de relevancia destacar que el señor Leonardo con mucho entusiasmo ha salido adelante pero hoy atraviesa la necesidad de invertir a lo inmediato en la compra de los productos ferreteros y es por esta razón que ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera lograr salir adelante en el negocio que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
Mr. Leonardo Manguia has been working for the past 20 years in the business of selling tools and hardware products in the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua. His business is is visted by a lot of customers that have helped make his business grow. Leonardo is very enthusiastic about doing better in life but now he realizes that he needs to invest in purchasing more hardware products to sell. This is why he has come to Ceprodel for a loan to invest as soon as possible to get his business to the point that he wants it to be at. He plans to increase his sales and to expand his business. He is asking for a loan of $325 to buy more products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his hardware store.

loans.name: Risafe

texts.en:
Risafe V. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 26 years old. Lucy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Risafe owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motor cab for hire services to the local community. Risafe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Risafe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Risafe successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase spare parts for maintenance. Risafe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for motor cab repair to provide service. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Risafe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Motor cab repair

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly V. is from the village of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married, and has seven adult children. Merly owns and operates a videoke business (also called karaoke - amateur singing to a music video background), providing videoke entertainment to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Merly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Benkadi 7 De (Benkadi  A Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI 7 de l’association BENKADI A sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles élargies  à TINGOLE  chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce nouveau prêt servira à   acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 24 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue à  Marka-Coungo et Fana,  après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 7 of the association BENKADI A are all married women who average 44 years of age and 3 children. The women live for the most part in traditional extended families in TINGOLE, the seat of a rural community in FANA subprefecture (2nd administrative region of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support for carrying out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum and peanuts. The group is now on its fifth experience with the institution. All the preceding loans were correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 24 hectares. A portion of their production is consumed at home. The other portion is sold after harvesting to customers composed of men and women in Marka-Coungo and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 30,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and sundry supplies and equipment

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
Reina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Reina es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Reina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra animales, luego los comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Reina tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Reina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gallina, cuy.
Los sueños de Reina son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina is a member of the Winarisun Community Bank. In Quechua, 'Winarisun' means 'May we Grow'. Reina is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She travels to different regional fairs and buys animals, then sells them in the City of Ayacucho. In addition, Reina operates a grocery store out of her house.

Reina needs a loan of $350 to buy hens and guinea pigs. She dreams of improving her business and offering a better education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING HENS AND GUINEA PIGS

loans.name: Santos Marina

texts.es: Santos Marina Z. D. R.  resiD. en San Martin municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Santos se encuentra casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, William el esposo D. Santos se dedica a las ventas D. manera ambulante y Santos posee un puesto donD. venD. variedad D. zapatos, esta joven pareja es muy unida, ya que el objetivo D. estos padres es sacar adelante a sus hijos, y poder brindarles una educación. Ahora Santos solicita este crédito para invertir en productos para su negocio el cual tiene ubicado en una buena zona por la afluencia D. personas, con este crédito Santos comprar mayor cantidad y variedad D. productos para ayudar a incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Santos Marina Z. D. R. lives in San Martin, a municipality in the province of San Salvador. Santos is married, and lives with her husband and two children. William, her husband, dedicates his time to traveling sales and Santos has a vendor stand where she sells a variety of shoes; this close young couple has the goal of offering a better future for their children and assuring their education. Santos requests this loan in order to invest in products for her business, which is located in a good area and attracts prosperous clients. She believes this loan will help her offer better inventory and product variety, to produce increased sales.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 45 years old.  She lives in the village of Roxas Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Panchito, who is now 42 years old and was working as a carpenter in their village. They have four children: Ramoncito – 22 years old, graduated in college with the degree in Information Technology; Arjie – 20 years old, presently working as company driver in Cauayan; Gerald – 18 years old, taking up a two-year course in Criminology and lastly Angelica – 16 years old, also studying in college taking up a degree in Hotel and Restaurant Management. 

Anecita is engaged in rice retailing business in their village. She is also accepting a laundry service where she manually washes clothes. She is patiently doing her work to able help her husband in bringing income to their family. She is also aiming to provide complete education to all her children which for her, is the best thing she could offer them by working hard in her rice retailing and accepting laundry service.  

Anecita is wishing to avail a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP4, 000 for the expansion of her rice retailing business. She is planning to purchase sacks of rice to be retailed. She is hoping that her product will be continuously available in order to provide the needs of the people in their community and her family daily needs. This will also bring them more profit which is very indispensable to the education of their children.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger E. lives in the town of Jang in Mahinog Camiguin Province. He is 40 years old, married, has three school-aged children and makes a living by providing transport services. He has been in this line of work for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP.

In 2008, Roger joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and business. He has successfully repaid three previous loans from HSPFI, and is applying for a new one for 11,000 PHP to buy items he needs for his motor vehicle. He plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy materials for his motor vehicle

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy K. is 37 years old and the father of two children. His oldest child is enrolled in the local school, the youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Chim Phary, is employed in a garment factory. He is a villager in Preak Sam Raung Village in the Kandal Province.

Vuthy K. owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. In addition to farming, he also sells soil. Unfortunately he does not earn enough income from his plantation to support his family's livelihood. Therefore, he decided to ask for a loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more land and cultivate more rice to earn additional income.

loans.use: To buy more land for rice cultivation

loans.name: Munkhtsog

texts.en:
Munkhtsog is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three of his four children in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son has joined the army, and the youngest two attend a local secondary school.

Munkhtsog runs a meat trading business with his wife in their town. He began his business in 1995 and since then has been able to purchase a truck and start a second business, a transportation service. Since beginning his second business, his wife is in charge of the meat trading business while Munkhtsog is in charge of the transportation business. He is requesting a 250,000 tugrug (~170 USD) loan in order to purchase livestock in order to sell their raw materials.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001 and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Aune

texts.en:
Aune E. sells tomatoes, groundnut paste, and rice. She is requesting a loan to buy more groundnuts to make paste. Aune is 38 years old and is married to a peasant. She has 8 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts to make groundnut paste

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: Jhonny de 28 años, vive al lado de su esposa Doris y sus dos hijos Alexander (13) y Válerie  (12), juntos conforman una familia  muy unida y viven en su casa propia.Desde muy joven aprendió a conducir y aún hoy le gusta  mucho esta actividad, alquila un auto  con el que trabaja realizando servicio de taxi.
