Todas las mañanas sin excepción  cuida y alimenta sus animales con bastante dedicación, pues las ganancias de la comercialización y producción  de sus animales es bastante rentable .Al día Roselfina puede extraer de 10 a 12 litros de leche, además su granja de cuyes esta en aumento y los vende casi todos los días. Paralelamente se dedica al cuidado de sus tierras de cultivo, en esta temporada  esta sembrando pastizales de alfalfa que son indispensables para  la alimentación de sus animales.Es la octava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será muy responsable con sus pagos,  también agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo pues  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Roselfina utilizará el dinero en la compra de más animales como cerdos y ovejas, para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos.
texts.en:
Roselfina, age 29, lives with her husband and 3 children in a house that they own. For the past 5 years, she has worked in agriculture. She also keeps cows and raises guinea pigs. Every morning, without exception, she feeds and cares for her animals with great dedication, since the income from their production and sale provides her with good profits. Each day, Roselfina's cows produce 10 to 12 liters of milk. Her guinea pig business is also expanding, with sales nearly every day. Parallel to this, she also cultivates her agricultural lands. During this season, she is planting fields of alfalfa, which is indispensable for her animals. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She would like to thank all of the people who made the loan possible, since it will be very useful to her in developing her business. Roselfina will use the funds to buy more animals, such as pigs and sheep, to fatten and sell.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos M. C., tiene la edad de 39 años, está en unión libre, y  tiene 4  hijos, tienen 1, 10, 16 y 17 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para hacer reparaciones en su casa. Desea comprar materiales para poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. También terminar algunos trabajos inconclusos en su casa. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Carlos se dedica a la agricultura, tiene algunos años dedicado a la siembra del café. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Carlos M. C., 39, is in a common-law marriage and has 4 children: aged 1, 10, 16 and 17. He wants a loan to make repairs to his house. He wants to buy materials with which he can improve the conditions of his home. He also wants to finish some unfinished projects in his house. This is the first time that he has taken a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very pleased with the ease of payments they provide. Don Carlos works in agriculture; he has cultivated coffee for a number of years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S., 54, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She produces traditional cakes to sell for an income of US $3 per day. Her husband is a lock repairman and sews shoes, earning an income of about US $2.80 per day. S. is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase more cake ingredients to produce more cakes for her customers. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to produce more cakes

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Petty trading, like the sale of groceries, is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start. It usually begins with tabletop selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually becomes a supermarket. Janet is one such entrepreneur. She has been selling groceries like washing powder, bottled water, canned foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc., for the past two years. Janet is 39 years old and married to a commercial driver. They have three children between the ages of 1 and 11 years. She is hoping that she will be able to expand her business and make more money to support the education of her children. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in purchasing groceries in bulk to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit and also expanding her market to include the sale of used clothes.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize, firewood and and a comal (typical Mexican griddle)

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia B. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 55 years old and married with four adult children. To make a living, Leticia has a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, talcum powder and toothpaste. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will also be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Leticia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Demna

texts.en:
Demna Y. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Demna is married and has a 13 year old child. To make a living, Demna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Demna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years. She works hard to improve her business and hopefully increase her harvest.

Demna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Demna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Demna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and improve their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Raúl; tiene 28 años de edad; el socio es soltero y tiene 1 hijo, el socio se dedica a la fabricación de chompas en lana de alpaca, el socio tiene su pequeño taller en Cusco y confecciona chompas de alpaca, El socio trabaja en su taller produciendo chompas de alpaca al por mayor junto a sus operarios y luego los vende en diferentes ferias artesanales y también trabaja a pedido de otros. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar lana de alpaca al por mayor teñidas y de colores naturales.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Raúl, 28, is single and has a son. He manufactures Alpaca wool sweaters in a small workshop he has in Cusco. He works in his workshop making Alpaca sweaters in quantity with his staff and then sells them in different crafts markets. He also works to fill third-party orders. He is asking for funds to buy Alpaca wool dyed in a variety of colors and in natural state. He is a member of the “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO” (Chinchero New Victory) communal bank located in Chinchero district, Urubamba province, Cusco department. It’s located 45 minutes from the city. He avails himself of this forum to express his gratitude for the loan and to commit to repay it in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Alpaca wool, both dyed in various colors and natural, at wholesale.

loans.name: Speratha

texts.en:
Speratha is 38 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 3 and 13. All but her youngest child are enrolled in school. Her husband works with Urunana Company, an acting troupe that is hired to convey social messages through plays and other forms of entertainment.  

For the last five years, Speratha has had a shop where she sells things such as soap, alcohol, cooking oil and other food items. With the proceeds of this loan, she is going to make improvements to her shop.  She says that the success of her business is due to the good customer care that she provides.  With the profit from her business, she is going to save up for a piece of land.

loans.use: Improvements to the shop

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee de 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora, ella tiene un hijo,  Ángel de 16, de su primer compromiso, actualmente convive con Antonio, de 28 años, él tiene hijo, Anderson de 4 años, juntos se unieron y viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. 

Desde muy niña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, ayudaba a sus padres a mantener su terreno de cultivo, ya cuando consolidó su familia, se dedicó a sembrar y cultivar en su propio terreno de cultivo. Ahora cultiva en dos hectáreas de terreno, papa, arveja y habas; los que después comercializa en el mercado central de su localidad, pero en temporadas de mayor cosecha los mismos compradores van hacia sus mismos campos a comprar lo que ha cosechado. 

En todo este tiempo ella pudo adquirir dos toros, con los que puede arar la tierra, de esa manera evitará el gasto de contratar personal. Con el tiempo se comprará mas hectáreas de terreno de cultivo, para poder sembrar más cantidad de papa y poder obtener mejores ganancias. 

Es el primer crédito con MFP y promete ser puntual y cumplida con su banco comunal, ya que le apoyan y entre ellos comparten experiencias positivas. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá comprar abono para las 40 hectáreas de papa que está sembrando (2 son propias y 38 son alquilados).
texts.en:
Haydee, age 41, is a hard-working woman. She has one 16-year-old son, Angel, from a previous relationship, and she currently lives with 28-year-old Antonio, who also has a 4-year-old son, Anderson, from a previous relationship. They live together in their own house in Chiras.  

She has worked the land since she was a very young girl.  She helped her parents maintain their crops.  When her family consolidated six years ago, she planted and grew crops on her own land.  She now grows potatoes, peas, and beans on two hectares of land.  She sells them in the central market in her area.  However, during the season when there is a large harvest, the same buyers go to their own fields to buy what has been harvested.

During all of this time she was able to buy two bulls.  She is able to plow the land with them.  This way she avoids the expense of hiring workers.  In time she will buy more hectares of land to cultivate.  She will do this in order to plant greater quantities of potatoes and to be able to obtain better earnings.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to be punctual with her communal bank. They support her, and they share positive experiences.  She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the 40 hectares of potatoes that she is planting (two are her own, the remaining 38 are rented).

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet K. lives in Naguru, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, five of whom are in school.  

Annet has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Annet sells her products from home, by means of retail. Annet has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. She also generates additional income through frying cassava and chips and plaiting hair.

The main business challenge(s) for Annet include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to villages for charcoal. Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sayra

texts.en:
Sayra I. is 45 years old, single, and has three children.  Since her family has limited resources, Sayra is engaged in the bottle redemption business. She accepts empty bottles and resells them to large factories.  This activity, however, is not very stable and thus not always profitable.  In 2002, she decided to start her own business in cattle breeding.  She worked hard to develop her business and grew her monthly benefits to 4,000 KGS.  Now Sayra plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase three bull calves which will allow her to earn income by means of livestock breeding.  In the future, she wants to give her children a good education.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan.  As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en: Nemat J.  is a 35 year old man who breeds cattle in the small village of Saatli city. He is married and has three children. Nemat has 3 years experience in this field. Currently he has three cows and his wife actively helps him. He sells milk and milk products to the local people but demand for milk products is higher than his cows can produce and this has pushed Nemat to purchase more cows to generate more milk. Nemat he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN  to purchase more cattle. This will allow him to increase his profit and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase three cows

loans.name: Jaih

texts.en: Jaih H. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Jaih operates a meat-trading business out of his own stall at the local market in his town. He began his business in 1999 with working capital of 200,000 Mongolin tugriks (MNT). After several years of operation, his working capital has grown to a level of 800,000 MNT today and he has managed to establish himself in the business community. Jaih says, "I want to expand my business and buy my own car in the future." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital due to an increase in the price of livestock.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Aneit

texts.en:
Aneit B. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Aneit is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Aneit owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Aneit has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aneit joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Aneit has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Aneit is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & junk foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Aneit from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages & junk foods.

loans.name: Ramila

texts.ru:
Ramila A. 46 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje. Ramila yeyo muj i deti jivut v qorode Baku. 
Uje 5  let kak Ramila zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji pishevix produktov. Seychas ona nujdayetsay v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye dlya toqo chtobi pomestit bolshe produktov dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Ramila A. is 46 years old. She is married and has two children, who are college student. Ramila  lives with her husband and children in the city of Baku.

For the last five years, Ramila has been in business selling groceries. At present she needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her store space  and be able to accommodate more wares.

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: Lucy Belen

texts.es:
Lucy de 34 años, tiene un negocio de venta de bollos (comida típica en las playas de Ecuador contiene plátanos y pescado).  Empezo el negocio con una herencia familiar ya que a los 16 años aprendió como preparar este platoo típico. 

Continúo con el negocio y lo convirtió en su negocio económico hasta ahora que tarabaj vendiendo bollos a un valor de $ 1.00 cada uno. Trabaja sola aunque en ocasiones le ayuda la hermana a realizar los bollos ya que hay que rayar mucho el platano para que quede en su punto y cocinarlo.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su negocio comprando con el préstamo cemento y materiales de construcción para mejorar el local donde los vende.
texts.en:
Lucy, age 34, has a bollos sales business (bollos are a typical food on the beaches of Ecuador, containing bananas and seafood). She started this  business from a family inheritance since she learned how to prepare this typical dish at the age of 16.

She continued with this business and converted it into her main source of income. She sells bollos at $1.00 each. She works alone, although her sister helps her to make the bollos since it is necessary to cut up the banana quite a bit so that it will be the proper shape before cooking it. She has many dreams for her business, so she wants to continue with her business. She will use this loan to buy cement and construction materials to improve the store where she sells the bollos.

loans.use: cement, sand, blocks

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is single. She is a market entrepreneur from Pavlograd. Nadezhda sells perfumes, cosmetics and personal care products in the central marketplace of her home town. She has already invested about 30,000 Grivnyas in this business; the profit is 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nadezhda started her enterprise 3 years ago. Today, Nadezhda owns a container-store. Container-stores are large metal shipping containers often used for overseas shipping. They can be used for storage, but make an ideal shelter from which market vendors can sell merchandise.

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and increase her working capital. Increased inventory turnover will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel C. is from the village of Barucboc, Quezon, Isabela. She is 33 years old. Richel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Richel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Richel has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2009, Richel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Richel is requesting a new loan of 23000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Richel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 30-year-old businessman who runs a cafeteria to earn a living. He also sells second-hand shoes to supplement his income. Most of his time he spends on selling shoes so he has employed four people to help him run the cafeteria. Prior to this, he was selling second-hand clothes. He hopes that someday, he will open a hotel.
Charles is very grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, because he has received training in customer care from them. This has meant that he has been able to attract many customers to his business and his income has increased. He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a freezer, utensils and cooking ingredients and to install electricity in his business premises.

loans.use: To buy a freezer, utensils and cooking ingredients, plus install electricity in business premises

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with twins. He lives in a small agricultural town of Vodyanoye. Alexander grows vegetables. He owns six big greenhouses and two separate ones for seedlings. He has invested about 70,000 Grivnyas in this business. Alexander has been in farming business for six years. 

Alexander is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase plastic film. He is planning to re-cover his six greenhouses before the upcoming spring farming season to plant early tomatoes and protect them from freezing temperatures. In general, Alexander is hoping to use 5,000 Grivnyas out of the whole amount to purchase the film, 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase fertilizers, 3,000 Grivnyas to purchase coal and the rest for miscellaneous expenses related to greenhouse business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic film for his greenhouses

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a married woman with five children. Four of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marjorie is 44 years old. 

Marjorie has a spices and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Marjorie requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell.

Marjorie has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Marjorie would like to send her children to school and have a good job.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia N. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old. Virginia is married and has two school-aged children. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling green bananas & coconut wines in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 13,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. Virginia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional yellow and green bananas. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional yellow and green bananas

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con sus tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de refrescos de horchata, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado municipal de san Francisco Gotera.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar ajonjolí,  morro, maní y azúcar, para preparar los refrescos, esta será una gran ayuda para ella y fortalecer el negocio, con suficiente material para preparar los productos.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos, mejorar su vivienda y fortalecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in San Francisco Gotera, located in the department of Morazán.  She lives with her three children, and dedicates herself to selling horchata (a milky, rice-based drink flavored with sugar and spices).  Her stall is located in the municipal market of San Francisco Gotera.

She requests a loan to buy sesame seeds, morro, peanuts, and sugar to make her refreshments.  This would help her a great deal in strengthening the business with enough supplies to make her product.

Her objectives are to help her children, improve her home, and strengthen her business.

loans.use: buy sesame seeds, morro, peanuts and sugar for making her beverages.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from the village of San Roque, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Emma is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk food & beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk food & beverages

location.town: San Roque, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Candawan

texts.en:
Candawan  is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 51 years old. Candawan is separated from his spouse and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Candawan owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Candawan has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Candawan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candawan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business by purchasing piglets to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Candawan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business by purchasing piglets to raise.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en: Pascasie is 36 years old. She has six children who are aged from four to 15, some of whom she has adopted. Five are at school while the youngest is not yet at school. Pascasie sells foodstuff  which she has been doing for the past three years. This business has enabled her to take care of her family. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuff. With the profits she plans to continue educating her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor trabaja como chofer en el sindicato Ciudad Satélite. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo para su vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros. Vive en casa de sus suegros ubicado en la zona de Villa Exaltación  en  la ciudad de El Alto;  es casado y tiene un dos. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2010.
texts.en:
Víctor works as a driver.  He is a member of the Ciudad Satélite drivers' union.  He needs this loan to buy a new engine for his passenger transport vehicle.

Víctor lives in his in-laws' home which is in Villa Exaltación district, in the city of El Alto.  He is married and two children.  He has been a client of IMPRO since 2010.

loans.use: to buy an engine for his passenger transport vehicle

loans.name: Solidario America Group

texts.es:
El grupo Solidario América lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. El coordinador del grupo es el señor José Javier de 27 años quien trabaja en la construcción desde hace 10 años  como albañil y cuenta con dos trabajadores. Él con el crédito construirá su casa comprara los materiales arena, cemento, bloques…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Sheila es comerciante de variedades los cuales vende por encargo desde hace 5 años y Reyna de 39 años tiene una fritanga desde hace 7 años.
texts.en:
The 'América' solidarity group has three hard-working and entrepreneurial members.  The group's coordinator is 27 year-old José Javier who has been working in the building trade as a builder for 10 years.  He has two workers.  He will use this loan to build his own house.  He will buy sand, cement, blocks, etc.

The other members of this group are Sheila, who has been selling a variety of merchandise to order for five years, and 39 year-old Reyna, who has owned a fried food joint for seven years.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies (cement, sand, blocks, etc.)

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi has operated a food stall business for the past year, preparing and selling food to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in the market. Her major goal is to establish a restaurant in the future.

Mwanamwinyi and her husband own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. They have three school-going children. Their greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she has requested, Mwanamwinyi wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, rice, beans, and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn, age 39, owns a store where she sells a variety of goods, such as soft drinks and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She and her husband have two children. The family lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 10,000.00 in order to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and canned goods to offer for sale in her shop. 

Jovelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to open a mini-mart.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks and canned goods to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is from the village of Tsinandali in the Kakheti region. She is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband, Ivane.

Natalia works in the Alexander Chavchavadze museum located in her village (Chavchavadze was a famous Georgian poet). Ivane works in a local winery. In addition to this work, Natalia and Ivane have a vineyard of two hectares as well as a one-hectare maize field. The family sells grapes and maize when they are in season. Their total monthly income is 750 GEL.

750 GEL does not result in enough to save up and beyond their present income. Therefore, Natalia has requested a loan of 1,100 GEL to purchase materials and hire laborers to renovate her house. The house was repaired a long time ago, and it is too uncomfortable now for the family.

After renovation, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase materials and hire laborers to renovate her house.

loans.name: Dulamhand

texts.en: Dulamhand is 34 years old and lives with her two daughters and father in a one-room apartment in Songinohairhan district, Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her two daughters are both high school students. Dulamhand operates picture trading business. She started her business in 2002. She paints by her self and sells her paintings at Local market. Her business is going well as she has collected nine years of working experience. She is planning to open her exhibition in the near future. She is a diligent and honest woman who says, "I want to expand my business and have constant income sources." She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT loan to remodel her apartment.

loans.use: To remodel her apartment

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena nació en el departamento del Cusco y tiene 48 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. Actualmente, Maria Elena vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la marca Ebel. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Maria Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar más cosméticos como por ejemplo perfumes, lápiz labial y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Maria Elena was born in Cusco department.  She is 48 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage.  Maria Elena currently lives in the city of Cusco and this is where she carries out her business activities.  Her business is selling Ebel-brand beauty products.  She has been in this business for five years and it is going very well.  On this occasion, Maria Elena needs a loan to buy more cosmetics such as perfume, lipstick and other products.

The 'Salud' community bank meets once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as being a very touristy, commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Amparito Manuelita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Nueva Kenedy se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Amparito, tiene 42 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de 20 y 16 años de edad, la mayor está casada y la menor vive con ella y estudian en colegio.
 
Nuestra amiga para poder salir adelante con sus hijas después de que se divorcio empezó un negocio en su casa, allí instalo con los pocos recursos que tenía un pequeño restaurante y con el paso de los días ha ido ampliando y mejorando para brindar un gran servicio a sus clientes, allí trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 6h00 hasta las 15h00, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y platos a la carta, nos cuenta que gracias a este negocio ha logrado salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijas. Con ella trabaja una chica a quien le paga un sueldo mensual.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Este es el primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The “New Kennedy” communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton that’s known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are recognized both nationally and internationally.  It’s where the famous straw hats come from.

We met Amparito, 42, here.  She’s separated and has two daughters who are 20 and 16 years old.  The oldest one is married and the younger one still lives with her and is going to school.

In order to get ahead with her daughters after her divorce, our friend started a home-based business.  She used the few resources she had to open a small restaurant and as time has passed has been expanding and improving it to provide great customer service.  She works there Monday through Saturday from 6am until 3pm.  She makes breakfasts, lunches and a la carte dishes.  She tells us that thanks to this business she’s managed to get ahead and help her daughters.  A young woman works with her that she pays a monthly salary to.

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other foodstuffs to prepare the meals.  This is the first cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because of the speed with which the loans are approved.  Her goal is to stay in business.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 33-year-old farmer married to Margret who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children who are five and two years old respectively. He has been a mixed crop farmer for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Wycliffe will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will venture into raising pigs. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and raise pigs in large amounts, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Rosmery Luz

texts.es: La señora Rosmery es cliente nueva de la institución la señora Rosmery ella tiene la actividad de peinadora,  tiene un pequeño hijito la señora Rosmery se dedica a realizar peinados  por toda la zona sur ya que su servicio lo realiza a domicilio ella vive en alquiler en una casa de la zona de Ovejuyo, su  esposo se dedica al manejo de una volqueta en una empresa con lo cual ayuda a la manutención de la familia ella esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de cepillos y tintes para el negocio ya que tiene que proveerse de material porque en cualquier momento le llaman sus clientes  para realizar peinados, ella es una persona joven  con ganas de superación y con el deseo de pronto tener su propio salón de belleza y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, la Sra. Rosmery se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Rosmery is a new client of the lending agency. She is a hair stylist and has a little boy. She provides her services throughout the southern region since she travels to her customers. She rents a house in the Ovejuyo region. Her husband drives a dump truck for a local business, which helps to cover the family’s living costs. Rosemery is requesting the loan to purchase brushes and dyes for her business. She must provide her own supplies since at any moment her customers could call on her to style their hair. She is a young woman who hopes to improve her life. She hopes to have her own beauty salon soon, and to be able to offer better service to her customers. Rosmery feels happy and grateful towards the lending agency for the help it has offered her.

loans.use: To purchase supplies, such as brushes and dyes, for hairstyling.

loans.name: Jose De La Cruz

texts.es: José De La Cruz es un joven incansable. Diariamente trabaja de 7 de la mañana a 7 de la noche en su vulcanizadora. Desde hace 17 años está dedicado a esta actividad con la que se ha sostenido. Comenzó cuando no tenía mucha experiencia porque era muy joven pero con el paso del tiempo fue mejorando obtuvo mucha clientela en el lugar donde estaba ubicado. Ahora solicita un crédito con el que pueda comprar llantas, herramientas, suavizantes, entre otros.
texts.en:
José de la Cruz is an industrious individual. He works from 7 in the morning to 7 at night every day in his tire repair shop, a job he’s been doing for 17 years. When he started he didn’t have much experience as he was very young, but as time passed he learned more and now he has many customers.

José is seeking a loan to buy tires, tools, fabric softener etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, fabric softener, tools etc.

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en:
Marlina is married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marlina is 52 years old and has five children who are in school.

Marlina has a natural medicine business in the Philippines. Marlina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Marlina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marlina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell to customers

loans.name: Elyse

texts.en:
Elyse is 27 years old and is married with two children between the ages of two and five years old.
He owns a business of transporting people. This is his first year in this business and he works from 6am until 10pm every day.

Elyse has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase spare parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) to help him in the business. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (tire, mirror, and engine) for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nelson Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Nelson tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de San Marcos de Colon, junto con el viven sus hijos y su esposa, Nelson es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su negocio propio que es venta de calzado, dicha actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, su negocio esta ubicado en un punto estrategico por el cual transitan muchas personas y esto hace que sea muy visitado, todos los dias se lavanta muy temprano para abrir su negocio, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de calzado al por mayor para tener mayores ventas y buenos ingresos para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Nelson is 41 years old and he lives in the town of San Marcos de Colon with his wife and their children. Nelson is a hardworking man committed to his retail activity: he sells shoes, an activity he has been engaged in for 4 years. His shop is located in a very convenient spot in the town center: as the area is attended by many people, the shop has many customers, and he gets up early every day to open his shop. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy shoes at wholesale price to improve his sales and increase his earning in order to offer a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: To buy shoes for his shop.

loans.name: Sultonkul

texts.ru: Султонкул женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Более 20 лет он занимается скотоводством, на данный момент имеет 7 голов коров и 8 голов овец. Он выполняет всю тяжелое работу, чтобы дать образование своим детям. Султонкул хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Он очень трудится и все его старания приносят ему стабильный доход и дают возможность продвигаться вперед. Султонкул планирует на полученную прибыль сыграть свадьбу сына. Все его планы требуют усердного труда и расширения бизнеса. С этой целью он хотел бы купить 2 голов крупного рогатого скота. Для этого он просит  вас помочь ему в осуществлении его планов. Он планирует после женитьбы сына открыть ему отдельный бизнес для самостоятельного ведения бизнеса.
texts.en: Sultonkul is married and is a responsible father of 2 children. He has been working in cattle breeding for over 20 years and currently owns 7 cows and 8 sheep. He is doing all the hard labor so that he can provide education for his children. Sultonkul wants to expand his business and get good income. He is working hard and his efforts will provide him a stable income and will allow him to move ahead. Sultonkul is planning to use the income to pay for his son's wedding. All his plans require hard work and business expansion. In order to do that he would like to purchase 2 additional heads of cattle. His is asking for your help in realizing his plans. He is planning to open a separate business for his son after the wedding.

loans.use: to buy two more cattle.

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en:
Arcadia is 57 years old and lives in Cang-inte, Siquijor.  She is married with five adult children.

Arcadia has a bread-making business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her bakery. Arcadia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for just one month.  In the future, Arcadia hopes to have savings and to be able to repair their house with the additional income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Lanie Jean

texts.en:
Lanie Jean is from Macupa, Tangub City. She is 20 years old. Lanie Jean is married and has one infant. 

To make a living, she plants, harvests, and sells bananas. Lanie Jean has been in her business for two years, and earns PHP 3000 a month from this activity. 

In 2009, Lanie Jean joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lanie Jean is requesting a loan of PHP 6,300 which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Jossias Nguiliche

texts.pt:
Jossias de 45 anos de idade, casado pai de 5 (filhos) dos quais 4 (quatros) estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario  a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è negociante de productos da primeira necessidade a mais de 10 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da primeira necessidade tais como: amendoim, arroz, feijao, caldo, rebucados e diversos prudutos para aumentar o volume do seu negocio no seu proprio estabelicimento comercial, actividade que esta ser acompanhado junto com a sua mulher
texts.en:
Jossias is 45 years old and married. He has five children, four of whom attend primary and secondary school and the other daughter is too young to go to school. He has been selling products that are household staples for over 10 years.
The current loan will be used to purchase products that are household staples such as peanuts, rice, beans, broths, candy and assorted goods so he can increase turnover in his store, a business he runs alongside his wife.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples such as peanuts, rice, beans, broths, candy and assorted goods so he can increase turnover in his business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie âgée de 54 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Marie est mariée à un certain Julien. Le couple n’a pas d’enfant. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari. les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple. Pour cette raison, Marie vend divers produits (du lait, des bougies et des bonbons). Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Marie achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Marie sollicite pour une troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés

loans.use: Acheter divers produits.

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es:
Ana, de 25 años de edad, estudio bachillerato opción secretariado, está casado, su esposo trabaja como albañil, tienen un hijo de tres años de edad y viven en casa familiar.

Ana, es empleada en una empresa de telefonía desde hace dos años, decidió buscar trabajo debido a la situación económica y para obtener ingresos mensuales, su lugar de trabajo está a diez minutos de su casa.
 
Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar frutas para vender en bolsas, porque su mamá vende estos productos y de esta manera ayuda con los gastos de la casa.

El sueño de Ana, es seguir trabajando para darle todo lo necesario a su hijo y ayudarle a sus padres en lo que pueda.

loans.use: para comprar frutas para vender en bolsas.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Mrs. Rosemary A. is 38 years old. She lives in a semi-urban part of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells her goods to people in her community. She is married with six children. She is a dedicated client of LAPO. She says that with a loan of $350, her business will be able to expand.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq has 6 years of experience in trade. He started receiving loans in July, 2005. He was one the first entrepreneurs in his town that received loans from MicroInvest and he has been advising the same to others since then. The loans he has been receiving were small in size because his business turnover is not very speedy. Sadiq is a handicapped person, but he has an active lifestyle.  He travels to Uzbekistan to buy the goods himself. His current business site is in open-air market and he would like to change it. Therefore he needs funds for new shelves and rent payment for the first three months.

loans.use: Change his business site

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Marco Antonio has had his house for more than 5 years. “Little by little, I have been improving the house where my mother and I live. We only have to finish the façade of the house and the fence, and then we will be more safe. There have been several robberies in the neighborhood. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to finish the façade and the fence.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Marco Antonio tiene su casa desde hace más de 5 año. Poco a poco le echo mejorar a la casa en ella vivimos mi mama y yo, solo nos ase faltar terminar la fachada y la barda y así estar mas seguros, ya que sean presentado barios robos en la colonia. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la terminación de la fachada y barda.

loans.use: To finish the facade of his house and and the fence around it
